01-03.title: Alaska Becomes 49th State
01-03.description: On January 3, 1959, Alaska was admitted as the 49th state of the United States.

01-04.title: Utah Becomes 45th State
01-04.description: On January 4, 1896, Utah was admitted as the 45th state of the United States.

01-05.title: National Hockey League Formed
01-05.description: On January 5, 1917, the National Hockey League (NHL) was formed in Montreal, Canada.

01-06.title: Feast of the Epiphany
01-06.description: Traditionally celebrated on January 6, this Christian feast day commemorates the visit of the Magi to the infant Jesus.

01-07.title: First U.S. Presidential Election
01-07.description: On January 7, 1789, the first U.S. presidential election was held, with George Washington unanimously elected.

01-08.title: Battle of New Orleans
01-08.description: On January 8, 1815, American forces defeated the British in the Battle of New Orleans, the final major battle of the War of 1812.

01-09.title: Apple Macintosh Unveiled
01-09.description: On January 9, 1984, Apple Computer unveiled the Macintosh, the first successful mouse-driven computer with a graphical user interface.

01-10.title: League of Nations Founded
01-10.description: On January 10, 1920, the League of Nations was formally established with the ratification of the Treaty of Versailles.

01-11.title: Amelia Earhart's Solo Flight
01-11.description: On January 11, 1935, Amelia Earhart became the first person to fly solo from Hawaii to California.

01-12.title: Haiti Earthquake
01-12.description: On January 12, 2010, a devastating 7.0 magnitude earthquake struck Haiti, killing approximately 230,000 people.

01-13.title: Treaty of Cahuenga Signed
01-13.description: On January 13, 1847, the Treaty of Cahuenga ended fighting in California during the Mexican-American War.

01-14.title: Treaty of Paris Ratified
01-14.description: On January 14, 1784, the Continental Congress ratified the Treaty of Paris, officially ending the American Revolutionary War.

01-15.title: Martin Luther King Jr. Born
01-15.description: Martin Luther King Jr. was born on January 15, 1929, in Atlanta, Georgia.

01-16.title: Prohibition Begins in U.S.
01-16.description: On January 16, 1920, the 18th Amendment went into effect, beginning Prohibition in the United States.

01-17.title: Operation Desert Storm Begins
01-17.description: On January 17, 1991, Operation Desert Storm began with airstrikes against Iraq following its invasion of Kuwait.

01-18.title: Captain Cook Reaches Hawaii
01-18.description: On January 18, 1778, Captain James Cook became the first European to reach the Hawaiian Islands.

01-19.title: Japan Leaves League of Nations
01-19.description: On January 19, 1933, Japan announced its withdrawal from the League of Nations following criticism of its occupation of Manchuria.

01-21.title: Concorde's First Commercial Flights
01-21.description: On January 21, 1976, the Concorde began its first commercial flights to London and Paris simultaneously.

01-22.title: Queen Victoria Dies
01-22.description: On January 22, 1901, Queen Victoria of the United Kingdom died after a reign of 63 years and 7 months.

01-23.title: 24th Amendment Ratified
01-23.description: On January 23, 1964, the 24th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution was ratified, abolishing poll taxes.

01-24.title: California Gold Discovery
01-24.description: On January 24, 1848, James W. Marshall discovered gold at Sutter's Mill in California, sparking the California Gold Rush.

01-25.title: First Winter Olympics
01-25.description: On January 25, 1924, the first Winter Olympics opened in Chamonix, France.

01-26.title: Australia Day
01-26.description: On January 26, 1788, the First Fleet arrived at Port Jackson, establishing the first European settlement in Australia.

01-27.title: Auschwitz Liberated
01-27.description: On January 27, 1945, Soviet troops liberated the Auschwitz concentration camp in Poland.

01-28.title: Space Shuttle Challenger Disaster
01-28.description: On January 28, 1986, the Space Shuttle Challenger broke apart 73 seconds into its flight, killing all seven crew members.

01-29.title: Kansas Becomes 34th State
01-29.description: On January 29, 1861, Kansas was admitted as the 34th state of the United States.

01-30.title: Mahatma Gandhi Assassinated
01-30.description: On January 30, 1948, Mahatma Gandhi was assassinated by Nathuram Godse in New Delhi, India.

01-31.title: U.S. Enters Space Age
01-31.description: On January 31, 1958, the United States launched its first satellite, Explorer 1, into space.

02-01.title: Columbia Space Shuttle Disaster
02-01.description: On February 1, 2003, the Space Shuttle Columbia disintegrated during re-entry, killing all seven crew members.

02-02.title: Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo
02-02.description: On February 2, 1848, the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo was signed, ending the Mexican-American War.

02-03.title: 16th Amendment Ratified
02-03.description: On February 3, 1913, the 16th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution was ratified, establishing federal income tax.

02-04.title: Facebook Launched
02-04.description: On February 4, 2004, Mark Zuckerberg launched Facebook from his Harvard dormitory room.

02-06.title: Queen Elizabeth II Ascends Throne
02-06.description: On February 6, 1952, Princess Elizabeth became Queen Elizabeth II following the death of her father, King George VI.

02-07.title: Great Fire of London
02-07.description: On February 7, 1812, a massive fire destroyed much of central London, though it is not as famous as the 1666 fire.

02-08.title: Mary, Queen of Scots Executed
02-08.description: On February 8, 1587, Mary, Queen of Scots was executed at Fotheringhay Castle in England.

02-10.title: Treaty of Paris Ends French and Indian War
02-10.description: On February 10, 1763, the Treaty of Paris was signed, ending the French and Indian War/Seven Years' War.

02-11.title: Nelson Mandela Released
02-11.description: On February 11, 1990, Nelson Mandela was released from prison after 27 years of incarceration in South Africa.

02-12.title: Abraham Lincoln's Birthday
02-12.description: Abraham Lincoln, the 16th President of the United States, was born on February 12, 1809, in Kentucky.

02-13.title: Firebombing of Dresden
02-13.description: On February 13-15, 1945, Allied forces firebombed Dresden, Germany, resulting in massive destruction and civilian casualties.

02-14.title: Saint Valentine's Day Massacre
02-14.description: On February 14, 1929, seven members of Chicago's North Side Gang were murdered by associates of Al Capone.

02-16.title: Lithuania Declares Independence
02-16.description: On February 16, 1918, Lithuania declared its independence from Russia and Germany.

02-17.title: First Issue of Newsweek Published
02-17.description: On February 17, 1933, the first issue of Newsweek magazine was published.

02-18.title: Pluto Discovered
02-18.description: On February 18, 1930, Clyde Tombaugh discovered Pluto at Lowell Observatory in Flagstaff, Arizona.

02-19.title: Japanese American Internment Begins
02-19.description: On February 19, 1942, President Franklin D. Roosevelt signed Executive Order 9066, authorizing Japanese American internment.

02-20.title: John Glenn Orbits Earth
02-20.description: On February 20, 1962, John Glenn became the first American to orbit the Earth aboard Friendship 7.

02-21.title: Malcolm X Assassinated
02-21.description: On February 21, 1965, Malcolm X was assassinated while speaking at the Audubon Ballroom in New York City.

02-22.title: George Washington's Birthday
02-22.description: George Washington, the first President of the United States, was born on February 22, 1732, in Virginia.

02-23.title: Iwo Jima Flag Raising
02-23.description: On February 23, 1945, U.S. Marines raised the American flag on Mount Suribachi during the Battle of Iwo Jima.

02-24.title: Gulf War Ground Offensive Begins
02-24.description: On February 24, 1991, the ground offensive of Operation Desert Storm began in the Gulf War.

02-25.title: People Power Revolution in Philippines
02-25.description: On February 25, 1986, the People Power Revolution ousted Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos from power.

02-26.title: World Trade Center Bombing
02-26.description: On February 26, 1993, a truck bomb exploded in the underground garage of the World Trade Center in New York City.

02-27.title: Reichstag Fire
02-27.description: On February 27, 1933, the German parliament building (Reichstag) was set on fire, a key event in Nazi Germany's rise.

02-28.title: Television's First Commercial
02-28.description: On February 28, 1939, the first television commercial aired in the United States during a baseball game.

03-01.title: Yellowstone National Park Established
03-01.description: On March 1, 1872, Yellowstone became the world's first national park when President Ulysses S. Grant signed the act into law.

03-02.title: Texas Declares Independence
03-02.description: On March 2, 1836, Texas declared its independence from Mexico, forming the Republic of Texas.

03-03.title: Treaty of Brest-Litovsk Signed
03-03.description: On March 3, 1918, Russia signed the Treaty of Brest-Litovsk with the Central Powers, exiting World War I.

03-04.title: First Inauguration in Washington D.C.
03-04.description: On March 4, 1801, Thomas Jefferson became the first president to be inaugurated in Washington, D.C.

03-05.title: Boston Massacre
03-05.description: On March 5, 1770, British soldiers killed five colonists in what became known as the Boston Massacre.

03-06.title: Dred Scott Decision
03-06.description: On March 6, 1857, the U.S. Supreme Court ruled in Dred Scott v. Sandford that African Americans could not be citizens.

03-07.title: Bloody Sunday
03-07.description: On March 7, 1965, civil rights marchers were attacked by state troopers on the Edmund Pettus Bridge in Selma, Alabama.

03-08.title: International Women's Day
03-08.description: First celebrated on March 8, 1911, International Women's Day honors women's achievements and promotes gender equality.

03-09.title: USS Monitor vs. CSS Virginia
03-09.description: On March 9, 1862, the first battle between ironclad warships, the Monitor and the Virginia, took place during the Civil War.

03-10.title: First Successful Telephone Call
03-10.description: On March 10, 1876, Alexander Graham Bell made the first successful telephone call, saying 'Mr. Watson, come here, I want to see you.'

03-11.title: Great Blizzard of 1888
03-11.description: On March 11-14, 1888, one of the most severe blizzards in American history struck the Northeast, causing massive disruption.

03-12.title: FDR's First Fireside Chat
03-12.description: On March 12, 1933, President Franklin D. Roosevelt delivered his first 'fireside chat' radio address to the American people.

03-13.title: William Herschel Discovers Uranus
03-13.description: On March 13, 1781, astronomer William Herschel discovered the planet Uranus, the first planet discovered with a telescope.

03-15.title: Ides of March - Julius Caesar Assassinated
03-15.description: On March 15, 44 BC, Roman dictator Julius Caesar was assassinated by a group of senators led by Brutus and Cassius.

03-16.title: My Lai Massacre
03-16.description: On March 16, 1968, American soldiers killed between 347 and 504 unarmed Vietnamese civilians in the My Lai Massacre.

03-17.title: Evacuation Day in Boston
03-17.description: On March 17, 1776, British forces evacuated Boston during the American Revolutionary War, celebrated as Evacuation Day.

03-18.title: Tripartite Convention Signed
03-18.description: On March 18, 1889, the Tripartite Convention established the colonial division of the Samoan Islands between Germany and the U.S.

03-19.title: Iraq War Begins
03-19.description: On March 19, 2003, the United States and coalition forces launched the invasion of Iraq.

03-20.title: Iraq War: 'Shock and Awe' Begins
03-20.description: On March 20, 2003, the United States launched its 'shock and awe' bombing campaign against Baghdad, marking a major escalation in the Iraq War.

03-21.title: Sharpeville Massacre
03-21.description: On March 21, 1960, South African police opened fire on a crowd of black protesters in Sharpeville, killing 69 people.

03-22.title: Stamp Act Passed
03-22.description: On March 22, 1765, the British Parliament passed the Stamp Act, imposing a direct tax on the American colonies.

03-23.title: Patrick Henry's 'Give Me Liberty' Speech
03-23.description: On March 23, 1775, Patrick Henry delivered his famous 'Give me liberty or give me death!' speech in Virginia.

03-24.title: Exxon Valdez Oil Spill
03-24.description: On March 24, 1989, the oil tanker Exxon Valdez ran aground in Alaska's Prince William Sound, causing a massive environmental disaster.

03-25.title: Slave Trade Abolished in British Empire
03-25.description: On March 25, 1807, the British Parliament passed the Slave Trade Act, abolishing the slave trade in the British Empire.

03-26.title: Bangladesh Independence Day
03-26.description: On March 26, 1971, Bangladesh declared its independence from Pakistan, beginning the Bangladesh Liberation War.

03-27.title: Alaska Earthquake
03-27.description: On March 27, 1964, the Good Friday earthquake struck Alaska, the most powerful earthquake recorded in North American history.

03-28.title: Three Mile Island Accident
03-28.description: On March 28, 1979, a partial nuclear meltdown occurred at the Three Mile Island Nuclear Generating Station in Pennsylvania.

03-29.title: Vietnam War Ends for U.S.
03-29.description: On March 29, 1973, the last U.S. combat troops left South Vietnam, ending direct American military involvement in the Vietnam War.

03-30.title: President Reagan Shot
03-30.description: On March 30, 1981, President Ronald Reagan was shot and wounded by John Hinckley Jr. outside a Washington, D.C. hotel.

03-31.title: Eiffel Tower Opens
03-31.description: On March 31, 1889, the Eiffel Tower was officially opened to the public during the Exposition Universelle in Paris.

04-01.title: Justinian I Named Co-ruler
04-01.description: On April 1, 527, Byzantine Emperor Justin I named his nephew Justinian I as co-ruler and successor to the throne.

04-01.title: Ruins of Pompeii Rediscovered
04-01.description: On April 1, 1748, the ruins of Pompeii were rediscovered by Spaniard Roque Joaquín de Alcubierre.

04-01.title: "Big Bang" Theory Proposed
04-01.description: On April 1, 1948, the "Big Bang" theory was proposed in the scientific journal "Physical Review" by American cosmologists Ralph Alpher, Hans Bethe, and George Gamow.

04-01.title: Khomeini Calls for Islamic Republic
04-01.description: On April 1, 1974, Ayatollah Khomeini called for an Islamic Republic in Iran.

04-01.title: Apple Computer Founded
04-01.description: On April 1, 1976, Steve Wozniak and Steve Jobs founded Apple Computer in the garage of Jobs' parents' house in Cupertino, California.

04-01.title: Netherlands Legalizes Same-Sex Marriage
04-01.description: On April 1, 2001, The Netherlands became the first country in the world to make same-sex marriage legal.

04-02.title: Ponce de León Claims Florida for Spain
04-02.description: On April 2, 1513, explorer Juan Ponce de León claimed Florida for Spain, becoming the first known European to reach it.

04-02.title: U.S. Mint Established
04-02.description: On April 2, 1792, the Coinage Act was passed, establishing the United States Mint and authorizing various gold and silver coins.

04-02.title: Battle of Copenhagen
04-02.description: On April 2, 1801, British naval forces led by Horatio Nelson destroyed the Danish fleet during the Napoleonic Wars.

04-02.title: Wilson Asks Congress to Declare War
04-02.description: On April 2, 1917, US President Woodrow Wilson asked Congress to declare war against Germany.

04-02.title: Haile Selassie Proclaimed Emperor
04-02.description: On April 2, 1930, Ras Tafari Makonnen was proclaimed Emperor Haile Selassie of Abyssinia (Ethiopia).

04-02.title: Argentina Invades Falkland Islands
04-02.description: On April 2, 1982, several thousand Argentine troops invaded and seized the Falkland Islands from the United Kingdom.

04-02.title: Record Unemployment Claims in U.S.
04-02.description: On April 2, 2020, a record 6.6 million Americans filed claims for unemployment in the prior week according to the US Department of Labor, totaling 10 million in two weeks.

04-03.title: Battle of Navarrete
04-03.description: On April 3, 1367, an alliance of Castilian and English forces defeated a rival Castilian army near Nájera, Castile.

04-03.title: Self-Denying Ordinance Passed
04-03.description: On April 3, 1645, the English Long Parliament passed the Self-Denying Ordinance, a significant step toward creating the New Model Army.

04-03.title: Pony Express Begins
04-03.description: On April 3, 1860, the Pony Express began, with mail delivered by horse and rider relay teams between St. Joseph, Missouri and Sacramento, California.

04-03.title: Stalin Appointed General Secretary
04-03.description: On April 3, 1922, Joseph Stalin was appointed General Secretary of the Russian Communist Party by an ailing Vladimir Lenin.

04-03.title: Truman Signs Marshall Plan
04-03.description: On April 3, 1948, US President Harry Truman signed the Marshall Plan to rebuild war-torn Western Europe, granting an initial $5 billion in aid.

04-03.title: First Mobile Phone Call
04-03.description: On April 3, 1973, the first mobile phone call was made in downtown Manhattan by Motorola employee Martin Cooper to Bell Labs headquarters in New Jersey.

04-03.title: Panama Papers Published
04-03.description: On April 3, 2016, the Panama Papers were published, exposing widespread illegal activities by the world's elite in the largest data leak in history.

04-04.title: Francis Drake Knighted
04-04.description: On April 4, 1581, Francis Drake was knighted by Queen Elizabeth I aboard his galleon, the "Golden Hind".

04-04.title: English Fleet Defeats Barbary Pirates
04-04.description: On April 4, 1655, in the Battle of Porto Farina, an English fleet defeated Barbary pirates in Tunis.

04-04.title: First U.S. Congress Begins Regular Sessions
04-04.description: On April 4, 1789, the first U.S. Congress began regular sessions at Federal Hall in New York City.

04-04.title: NATO Established
04-04.description: On April 4, 1949, the North Atlantic Treaty was signed in Washington, D.C., establishing the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO).

04-04.title: Martin Luther King Jr. Assassinated
04-04.description: On April 4, 1968, U.S. civil rights activist Martin Luther King Jr. was assassinated by James Earl Ray at the Lorraine Hotel in Memphis, Tennessee.

04-04.title: World Trade Center Opens
04-04.description: On April 4, 1973, the World Trade Center opened in New York as the world's tallest building.

04-04.title: Microsoft Founded
04-04.description: On April 4, 1975, Microsoft was founded as a partnership between Bill Gates and Paul Allen to develop and sell BASIC interpreters for the Altair 8800.

04-05.title: Battle on the Ice
04-05.description: On April 5, 1242, Russian Prince Alexander Nevsky defeated the Teutonic Knights on the frozen Lake Peipus.

04-05.title: Easter Island Discovered by Europeans
04-05.description: On April 5, 1722, Dutch navigator Jacob Roggeveen became the first European to discover Easter Island.

04-05.title: Battle of Maipú
04-05.description: On April 5, 1818, Chile's independence movement won a decisive victory over Spain at the Battle of Maipú.

04-05.title: First Civic Public Park Opens
04-05.description: On April 5, 1847, the first civic public park, Birkenhead Park, designed by Joseph Paxton, opened in Birkenhead, England.

04-05.title: War of the Pacific Begins
04-05.description: On April 5, 1879, Chile declared war on Bolivia and Peru, starting the War of the Pacific.

04-06.title: Battle of Thapsus
04-06.description: On April 6, 46 BC, Julius Caesar defeated the army of Caecilius Metellus Scipio and Marcus Porcius Cato near Thapsus in modern-day Tunisia.

04-06.title: Siege of Constantinople Begins
04-06.description: On April 6, 1453, Turkish forces under Sultan Mehmed II began the siege of Constantinople, which fell on May 29.

04-06.title: Cape Colony Established
04-06.description: On April 6, 1652, the Cape Colony, the first European settlement in South Africa, was established by the Dutch East India Company.

04-06.title: U.S. Enters World War I
04-06.description: On April 6, 1917, the United States declared war on Germany, entering World War I on the side of the Allies.

04-06.title: Rwandan Genocide Begins
04-06.description: On April 6, 1994, a plane carrying the presidents of Rwanda and Burundi was shot down, sparking the Rwandan Genocide.

04-07.title: Estimated Date of Jesus's Crucifixion
04-07.description: On April 7, 30 AD, scholars estimate this as a possible date for the crucifixion of Jesus by Roman troops in Jerusalem (April 3 is also proposed).

04-07.title: Justinian Code Issued
04-07.description: On April 7, 529, the first draft of the Justinian Code (Corpus Juris Civilis), a fundamental work in jurisprudence, was issued by Emperor Justinian I.

04-07.title: World Health Organization Formed
04-07.description: On April 7, 1948, the World Health Organization was formed by the United Nations.

04-07.title: Eisenhower's 'Domino Effect' Speech
04-07.description: On April 7, 1954, US President Dwight D. Eisenhower was the first to voice fear of a "domino effect" of communism in Indochina.

04-07.title: Riots Continue After MLK Assassination
04-07.description: On April 7, 1968, riots continued in over 100 U.S. cities following the assassination of Martin Luther King Jr.

04-07.title: Internet's Symbolic Birth Date
04-07.description: On April 7, 1969, the Internet's symbolic birth date was marked by the publication of Request for Comments (RFC) 1.

04-08.title: Ayutthaya Kingdom Falls
04-08.description: On April 8, 1767, the Ayutthaya Kingdom in present-day Thailand fell to Burmese invaders.

04-08.title: Venus de Milo Discovered
04-08.description: On April 8, 1820, the famous ancient Greek statue Venus de Milo was discovered on the Aegean island of Milos.

04-08.title: First Irish Home Rule Bill
04-08.description: On April 8, 1886, William Gladstone introduced the first Irish Home Rule Bill in the British House of Commons.

04-08.title: Battle of Atbara River
04-08.description: On April 8, 1898, Anglo-Egyptian forces defeated 15,000 Sudanese in a turning point in the reconquest of Sudan.

04-08.title: China's First Parliament Opens
04-08.description: On April 8, 1913, China's National Assembly opened in Peking, the first free democratic parliament in Chinese history.

04-08.title: Darfur Ceasefire Agreement Signed
04-08.description: On April 8, 2004, a Humanitarian Ceasefire Agreement on the Conflict in Darfur was signed by the Sudanese government and two rebel groups.

04-09.title: Edward V Succeeds to English Throne
04-09.description: On April 9, 1483, Edward V, aged 12, succeeded his father Edward IV as King of England. He was never crowned and disappeared, presumed murdered.

04-09.title: War of Jenkins' Ear Catalyst
04-09.description: On April 9, 1731, British mariner Robert Jenkins' ear was cut off by the Spanish Guarde Costa, a catalyst for a later war between Britain and Spain.

04-09.title: John Hancock Resists British Customs
04-09.description: On April 9, 1768, John Hancock refused to allow two British customs agents below deck of his ship, considered an early act of physical resistance to British authority.

04-09.title: Lee Surrenders at Appomattox
04-09.description: On April 9, 1865, Confederate General Robert E. Lee and 26,765 troops surrendered at Appomattox Court House to U.S. Lieutenant General Ulysses S. Grant.

04-09.title: Hudson's Bay Company Cedes Territory
04-09.description: On April 9, 1869, the Hudson's Bay Company ceded its territory to Canada.

04-09.title: John Major Elected UK Prime Minister
04-09.description: On April 9, 1992, John Major was elected Prime Minister of the United Kingdom after his Conservative Party won the most votes in British electoral history.

04-09.title: Baghdad Falls to US Forces
04-09.description: On April 9, 2003, Baghdad fell to US forces, ending the invasion of Iraq and resulting in widespread looting.

04-10.title: Lama Deshin Shekpa Visits Ming Capital
04-10.description: On April 10, 1407, Lama Deshin Shekpa visited the Ming Dynasty capital at Nanjing and received the title Great Treasure Prince of Dharma.

04-10.title: Mount Tambora Erupts
04-10.description: On April 10, 1815, Mount Tambora experienced a cataclysmic eruption, one of the most powerful in history, killing around 71,000 people and causing a global volcanic winter.

04-10.title: Big Ben Bell Recast
04-10.description: On April 10, 1858, Big Ben, a 13.76-tonne bell, was recast at the Whitechapel Bell Foundry.

04-10.title: Biological Weapons Convention Agreed
04-10.description: On April 10, 1972, the US, USSR and 70 other nations agreed to ban biological weapons at the Biological Weapons Convention.

04-10.title: Good Friday Agreement Signed
04-10.description: On April 10, 1998, the Good Friday Agreement (Belfast Agreement) for Northern Ireland was signed by the British and Irish governments.

04-11.title: Battle of Ravenna
04-11.description: On April 11, 1512, French forces under Gaston de Foix defeated the Holy League in a major battle of the Italian Wars.

04-11.title: American Revolutionary War Hostilities Cease
04-11.description: On April 11, 1783, hostilities formally ceased in the American Revolutionary War after the Continental Congress proclaimed the "Cessation of Arms".

04-11.title: Napoléon Bonaparte Abdicates
04-11.description: On April 11, 1814, Napoléon Bonaparte abdicated unconditionally and was exiled to the island of Elba.

04-11.title: Shogunate Abolished in Japan
04-11.description: On April 11, 1868, the Shogunate was abolished in Japan.

04-11.title: Air India Plane Bombed
04-11.description: On April 11, 1955, a chartered Air India plane was bombed and crashed into the South China Sea in a failed assassination attempt on Zhou Enlai.

04-11.title: Civil Rights Act of 1968 Signed
04-11.description: On April 11, 1968, US President Lyndon B. Johnson signed the 1968 Civil Rights Act.

04-11.title: Idi Amin Overthrown
04-11.description: On April 11, 1979, the Tanzanian army captured Kampala, forcing Ugandan dictator Idi Amin to flee into exile.

04-11.title: First U.S.-Cuba Leaders Meeting Since 1959
04-11.description: On April 11, 2015, Barack Obama and Raúl Castro met in Panama, the first meeting of US and Cuban heads of state since the Cuban Revolution.

04-11.title: Sudanese President Omar al-Bashir Overthrown
04-11.description: On April 11, 2019, Sudanese President Omar al-Bashir was overthrown and arrested by the army in Khartoum after 30 years in power.

04-12.title: Fourth Crusade Sacks Constantinople
04-12.description: On April 12, 1204, the Fourth Crusade occupied and plundered Constantinople.

04-12.title: First U.S. Colonists Arrive on Pacific Coast
04-12.description: On April 12, 1811, the first U.S. colonists on the Pacific coast arrived at Cape Disappointment, Washington.

04-12.title: American Civil War Begins
04-12.description: On April 12, 1861, Fort Sumter in South Carolina was attacked by the Confederacy, beginning the American Civil War.

04-12.title: Chiang Kai-shek Begins Counter-Revolution
04-12.description: On April 12, 1927, Kuomintang leader Chiang Kai-shek began a counter-revolution by violently suppressing Communist groups.

04-12.title: First Human in Space
04-12.description: On April 12, 1961, Soviet cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin became the first human to travel into space and orbit Earth aboard the Vostok 1 spacecraft.

04-12.title: First Malaria Vaccine Approved in Africa
04-12.description: On April 12, 2023, Ghana became the first country to approve a new vaccine for malaria, Mosquirix (RTS,S), developed at Oxford University.

04-13.title: Seventh Crusade Defeated in Egypt
04-13.description: On April 13, 1250, the Seventh Crusade was defeated in Egypt, and Louis IX of France was captured.

04-13.title: Edict of Nantes Grants Rights to Huguenots
04-13.description: On April 13, 1598, the Edict of Nantes granted political rights to French Huguenots.

04-13.title: First Pony Express Mail Reaches California
04-13.description: On April 13, 1860, the first Pony Express rider reached Sacramento, California.

04-13.title: Abyssinian War Ends
04-13.description: On April 13, 1868, the Abyssinian War ended as British and Indian troops captured Magdala and Ethiopian Emperor Tewodros II committed suicide.

04-13.title: Apollo 13 Announces 'Problem'
04-13.description: On April 13, 1970, Apollo 13 announced, "Okay, Houston, we've had a problem here" after an oxygen tank exploded en route to the Moon.

04-14.title: Abraham Lincoln Assassinated
04-14.description: On April 14, 1865, US President Abraham Lincoln was shot in the head by John Wilkes Booth at Ford's Theatre in Washington; he died a day later.

04-14.title: Titanic Hits an Iceberg
04-14.description: On April 14, 1912, the RMS Titanic hit an iceberg at 11:40pm off Newfoundland, sinking in the early hours of April 15.

04-14.title: Typhus Fever Bacteria Isolated
04-14.description: On April 14, 1914, Dr. Harry Plotz isolated the bacteria that causes typhus fever at Mount Sinai Hospital in New York City.

04-14.title: Black Sunday Dust Storm
04-14.description: On April 14, 1935, the Black Sunday dust storm ravaged the US Midwest, leading to the region being named the "Dust Bowl".

04-14.title: First Space Shuttle Returns to Earth
04-14.description: On April 14, 1981, the first Space Shuttle, Columbia, returned to Earth after 2 days and 6 hours in space.

04-14.title: Human Genome Project Completed
04-14.description: On April 14, 2003, the Human Genome Project was completed with 99% of the human genome sequenced to an accuracy of 99.99%.

04-15.title: Johnson's 'Dictionary of the English Language' Published
04-15.description: On April 15, 1755, Samuel Johnson's "A Dictionary of the English Language" was published in London.

04-15.title: Lincoln Mobilizes Federal Army
04-15.description: On April 15, 1861, a federal army of 75,000 volunteers was mobilized by President Abraham Lincoln at the start of the American Civil War.

04-15.title: First Impressionist Art Exhibition
04-15.description: On April 15, 1874, the first Impressionist art exhibition opened in Paris, featuring artists like Monet, Degas, and Renoir.

04-15.title: World's First Home Telephone Installed
04-15.description: On April 15, 1877, the world's first home telephone was installed in Somerville, Massachusetts at the house of Charles Williams Jr.

04-15.title: RMS Titanic Sinks
04-15.description: On April 15, 1912, the RMS Titanic sank at 2:20 AM off Newfoundland with the loss of between 1,490 and 1,635 lives.

04-16.title: Battle of Megiddo
04-16.description: On April 16, 1457 BC, Egyptian forces of Thutmose III defeated a large Canaanite coalition. It is the first battle recorded with a reliable account.

04-16.title: Isaac Newton Knighted
04-16.description: On April 16, 1705, Queen Anne of England knighted scientist Isaac Newton at Trinity College, Cambridge.

04-16.title: Battle of Culloden
04-16.description: On April 16, 1746, Royalist troops under the Duke of Cumberland defeated the Jacobite army of Charles Edward Stuart in the final battle of the Jacobite Rising.

04-16.title: First U.S. Stamp Booklets Issued
04-16.description: On April 16, 1900, the U.S. Post Office issued its first stamp booklets.

04-16.title: OEEC Forms in Paris
04-16.description: On April 16, 1948, the Organization for European Economic Cooperation (OEEC) formed in Paris.

04-16.title: Treaty of Accession Signed for EU
04-16.description: On April 16, 2003, the Treaty of Accession was signed in Athens, admitting 10 new member states to the European Union.

04-17.title: Columbus Signs Contract for Voyage
04-17.description: On April 17, 1492, Christopher Columbus signed a contract with Spanish monarchs to find the "Indies," promising him 10% of all riches found.

04-17.title: Treaty of Shimonoseki Signed
04-17.description: On April 17, 1895, the Treaty of Shimonoseki was signed, ending the First Sino-Japanese War.

04-17.title: Lenin Issues 'April Theses'
04-17.description: On April 17, 1917, Vladimir Lenin issued his radical "April Theses" calling for Soviets to take power during the Russian Revolution.

04-17.title: Bay of Pigs Invasion
04-17.description: On April 17, 1961, 1,400 Cuban exiles landed in the Bay of Pigs in a doomed attempt to overthrow Fidel Castro.

04-17.title: Canada's Constitution Act Proclaimed
04-17.description: On April 17, 1982, the "Proclamation of the Constitution Act" was signed, establishing Canada's "Charter of Rights and Freedoms".

04-17.title: St. Cuthbert Gospel Purchased by British Library
04-17.description: On April 17, 2012, the 8th-century St. Cuthbert Gospel, Europe's oldest intact book, was purchased by the British Library for £9 million.

04-18.title: First King of Poland Crowned
04-18.description: On April 18, 1025, Bolesław I the Brave was crowned in Gniezno, becoming the first King of Poland.

04-18.title: Cornerstone of St. Peter's Basilica Laid
04-18.description: On April 18, 1506, the cornerstone of the current St. Peter's Basilica was laid in the Vatican by Pope Julius II.

04-18.title: Paul Revere's Midnight Ride
04-18.description: On April 18, 1775, Paul Revere, William Dawes, and Samuel Prescott rode from Charlestown to Lexington warning "the regulars are coming out!"

04-18.title: Washington Announces End of Revolutionary War Hostilities
04-18.description: On April 18, 1783, George Washington issued General Orders announcing the end of hostilities with Britain in the American Revolutionary War.

04-18.title: San Francisco Earthquake and Fire
04-18.description: On April 18, 1906, the San Francisco earthquake and fire killed nearly 4,000 while destroying 75% of the city.

04-18.title: Joan of Arc Beatified
04-18.description: On April 18, 1909, Joan of Arc received beatification by the Roman Catholic Church at St. Peter's Basilica in the Vatican.

04-18.title: Superman First Appears
04-18.description: On April 18, 1938, Superman first appeared in DC Comics' Action Comics Series Issue #1.

04-18.title: Gamal Abdel Nasser Seizes Power in Egypt
04-18.description: On April 18, 1954, Egyptian Colonel Gamal Abdel Nasser seized power and appointed himself Prime Minister.

04-19.title: Captain Cook First Sights Australia
04-19.description: On April 19, 1770, British explorer Captain James Cook first sighted Australia.

04-19.title: American Revolution Begins
04-19.description: On April 19, 1775, the American Revolution began in Lexington, Massachusetts, with the "Shot Heard Round the World" fired later that day in Concord.

04-19.title: Oklahoma City Bombing
04-19.description: On April 19, 1995, a truck bomb set by Timothy McVeigh at the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building killed 168 people and injured over 500.

04-19.title: Fidel Castro Resigns from Communist Party
04-19.description: On April 19, 2011, Fidel Castro resigned his position as First Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba after 45 years.

04-20.title: Winchester Round Table Tournament
04-20.description: On April 20, 1290, a Round Table tournament was held near Winchester, England, in imitation of King Arthur, to commemorate a royal betrothal.

04-20.title: First Pasteurization Test Completed
04-20.description: On April 20, 1862, the first pasteurization test was completed by Frenchmen Louis Pasteur and Claude Bernard.

04-20.title: Marie and Pierre Curie Isolate Radium
04-20.description: On April 20, 1902, Marie and Pierre Curie isolated the radioactive compound radium chloride.

04-20.title: Enoch Powell's 'Rivers of Blood' Speech
04-20.description: On April 20, 1968, British politician Enoch Powell made his controversial "Rivers of Blood" speech.

04-20.title: Berber Spring in Algeria
04-20.description: On April 20, 1980, the climax of the Berber Spring in Algeria saw hundreds of Berber political activists arrested.

04-20.title: Columbine High School Massacre
04-20.description: On April 20, 1999, Eric Harris and Dylan Klebold killed 13 people and injured 24 others before committing suicide at Columbine High School, Colorado.

04-20.title: Deepwater Horizon Explosion
04-20.description: On April 20, 2010, the Deepwater Horizon drilling rig exploded, killing 11 and causing a massive oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico.

04-20.title: U.S. House Passes Foreign Aid Package
04-20.description: On April 20, 2024, the U.S. House passed a bipartisan $95 billion foreign aid package for Ukraine, Israel, and Taiwan, along with a bill against TikTok.

04-21.title: Traditional Date for the Founding of Rome
04-21.description: On April 21, 753 BC, Romulus and Remus traditionally founded the city of Rome.

04-21.title: First Battle of Panipat
04-21.description: On April 21, 1526, Central Asian conqueror Babur defeated Sultan Ibrahim Lodi, establishing the Mughal Empire in India.

04-21.title: Brazilian Revolutionary Tiradentes Executed
04-21.description: On April 21, 1792, Brazilian revolutionary Tiradentes was hanged, drawn, and quartered in Rio de Janeiro.

04-21.title: Bahá'u'lláh Declares His Mission
04-21.description: On April 21, 1863, Bahá'u'lláh, founder of the Bahá'í Faith, entered the garden of Ridván near Baghdad and made his declaration as a Messenger of God.

04-21.title: The Red Baron Shot Down
04-21.description: On April 21, 1918, German fighter ace Baron Manfred von Richthofen, known as "The Red Baron," was shot down and killed over France.

04-21.title: Tiananmen Square Protests Grow
04-21.description: On April 21, 1989, thousands of Chinese crowded into Beijing's Tiananmen Square, cheering for students demanding greater political freedom.

04-22.title: Portuguese Discover Brazil
04-22.description: On April 22, 1500, Pedro Álvares Cabral became the first European to discover Brazil, claiming it for Portugal.

04-22.title: First Military Use of Poison Gas
04-22.description: On April 22, 1915, Germany used chlorine gas against the Allies at Ypres, France, in the first major use of poison gas in World War I.

04-22.title: Holocaust Memorial Museum Dedicated
04-22.description: On April 22, 1993, the Holocaust Memorial Museum was dedicated in Washington, D.C.

04-22.title: Kibuye Massacre in Rwanda
04-22.description: On April 22, 1994, 7,000 Tutsi were slaughtered by Hutus in the stadium at Kibuye, Rwanda.

04-22.title: Nepalese Pro-Democracy Protests
04-22.description: On April 22, 2006, Nepalese security forces opened fire on pro-democracy protesters demonstrating against King Gyanendra.

04-22.title: Paris Agreement Signed
04-22.description: On April 22, 2016, the Paris Agreement on climate change was signed in New York, binding 195 nations to limit global warming.

04-23.title: Temple to Venus Erycina Built
04-23.description: On April 23, 215 BC, a temple dedicated to Venus Erycina was built on Capitoline Hill to commemorate the Roman defeat at Lake Trasimene.

04-23.title: Battle of Clontarf
04-23.description: On April 23, 1014, King Brian Boru of Ireland defeated Viking forces at the Battle of Clontarf, freeing Ireland from foreign control.

04-23.title: Shakespeare's 'The Merry Wives of Windsor' First Performed
04-23.description: On April 23, 1597, William Shakespeare's "The Merry Wives of Windsor" was first performed with Queen Elizabeth I in attendance.

04-23.title: Robert E. Lee Commands Virginia's Forces
04-23.description: On April 23, 1861, Robert E. Lee was named commander of Virginia's Confederate forces during the US Civil War.

04-23.title: First Decimal Coins Issued in Britain
04-23.description: On April 23, 1968, the first decimal coins were issued in Britain, the 5 and 10 new pence pieces.

04-23.title: AIDS Virus Identified
04-23.description: On April 23, 1984, the AIDS virus was identified as HTLV-III (Human T-lymphotropic Virus Type III).

04-24.title: Traditional Date of the Trojan Horse
04-24.description: On April 24, 1184 BC, the Greeks are said to have entered Troy using the Trojan Horse (traditional date).

04-24.title: Russo-Turkish War Begins
04-24.description: On April 24, 1877, Russia declared war on the Ottoman Empire, beginning the Russo-Turkish War.

04-24.title: Spain Declares War on the United States
04-24.description: On April 24, 1898, Spain declared war after rejecting a US ultimatum to withdraw from Cuba, beginning the Spanish–American War.

04-24.title: Easter Rising Begins in Dublin
04-24.description: On April 24, 1916, the Easter Rising of Irish republicans against British rule began in Dublin.

04-24.title: General Westmoreland Criticizes U.S. War Protesters
04-24.description: On April 24, 1967, General William Westmoreland stated that the enemy in Vietnam "gained support in the United States that gives him hope that he can win politically."

04-24.title: India Becomes World's Most Populous Country
04-24.description: On April 24, 2023, India surpassed China as the world's most populous country according to UN estimates.

04-25.title: English Parliament Votes to Restore Monarchy
04-25.description: On April 25, 1660, the English Convention Parliament met and voted to restore Charles II to the throne.

04-25.title: Guillotine First Used in France
04-25.description: On April 25, 1792, the guillotine was first used in France to execute highwayman Nicolas Pelletier.

04-25.title: Mexican–American War Begins
04-25.description: On April 25, 1846, the Thornton Affair marked the beginning of open conflict over the disputed border of Texas, triggering the Mexican–American War.

04-25.title: Gallipoli Campaign Landings
04-25.description: On April 25, 1915, the first landings were made at Gaba Tepe and Cape Helles on the Gallipoli Peninsula by ANZAC forces during World War I.

04-25.title: San Remo Conference Establishes Mandates
04-25.description: On April 25, 1920, the San Remo conference established League of Nations mandates for Syria, Mesopotamia, and Palestine.

04-25.title: Elbe Day: U.S. and Soviet Forces Meet
04-25.description: On April 25, 1945, U.S. and Soviet forces met at Torgau, Germany on the Elbe River during the invasion of Germany in World War II.

04-25.title: DNA's Double Helix Structure Published
04-25.description: On April 25, 1953, Francis Crick and James Watson's discovery of the double helix structure of DNA was published in "Nature" magazine.

04-25.title: First Solar Battery Announced
04-25.description: On April 25, 1954, Bell Labs announced the first solar battery made from silicon, which had about 6% efficiency.

04-25.title: Hubble Telescope Placed in Orbit
04-25.description: On April 25, 1990, the Hubble space telescope was placed into orbit by space shuttle Discovery.

04-26.title: Pazzi Conspiracy in Florence
04-26.description: On April 26, 1478, Pazzi conspirators attacked Lorenzo de' Medici and killed his brother Giuliano de' Medici in Florence.

04-26.title: The 'Great Debate' in Astronomy
04-26.description: On April 26, 1920, astronomers Harlow Shapley and Heber D. Curtis held the "Great Debate" on the nature and size of the universe.

04-26.title: Vichy France Leader Philippe Pétain Arrested
04-26.description: On April 26, 1945, Marshal Philippe Pétain, leader of France's Vichy collaborationist regime, was arrested for treason.

04-26.title: First Modern Container Ship Sails
04-26.description: On April 26, 1956, the first modern container ship, the Ideal X, left Port Newark, New Jersey for Houston, Texas.

04-26.title: Chernobyl Nuclear Disaster
04-26.description: On April 26, 1986, the world's worst nuclear disaster occurred when a reactor at the Chernobyl nuclear power station in the Soviet Union exploded.

04-26.title: Syria Withdraws from Lebanon
04-26.description: On April 26, 2005, under international pressure, Syria withdrew the last of its troops from Lebanon, ending its 29-year military domination.

04-27.title: First Spanish Settlement in Philippines
04-27.description: On April 27, 1565, the first Spanish settlement in the Philippines was founded in Cebu City.

04-27.title: SS Sultana Disaster
04-27.description: On April 27, 1865, the steamboat "SS Sultana" exploded in the Mississippi River, killing up to 1,800 people in the greatest maritime disaster in United States history.

04-27.title: World's First Labor Government
04-27.description: On April 27, 1904, the Australian Labor Party under Prime Minister Chris Watson became the first Labor government in the world.

04-27.title: Benito Mussolini Captured
04-27.description: On April 27, 1945, Italian partisans captured Benito Mussolini in Dongo, near Lake Como.

04-27.title: Airbus A380 Makes First Flight
04-27.description: On April 27, 2005, the superjumbo jet aircraft Airbus A380 made its first flight from Toulouse, France.

04-28.title: Asia's Oldest University Established
04-28.description: On April 28, 1611, the Pontifical and Royal University of Santo Tomas, the oldest existing university in Asia, was established in the Philippines.

04-28.title: Captain Cook Lands in Australia
04-28.description: On April 28, 1770, British Captain James Cook, aboard HMS Endeavour, first landed in Australia at Botany Bay.

04-28.title: Mutiny on the Bounty
04-28.description: On April 28, 1789, Fletcher Christian led a mutiny on HMS Bounty against its captain William Bligh in the South Pacific.

04-28.title: First Night Air Flight
04-28.description: On April 28, 1910, the first night air flight by Claude Grahame-White took place in England.

04-28.title: First Commercial Trans-Pacific Flight
04-28.description: On April 28, 1937, the first commercial flight across the Pacific was operated by Pan Am.

04-28.title: Baader-Meinhof Gang Members Jailed
04-28.description: On April 28, 1977, Andreas Baader and members of the terrorist group Red Army Faction (Baader-Meinhof Gang) were jailed for life in Stuttgart, Germany.

04-29.title: Battle of Gate Pā
04-29.description: On April 29, 1864, 1,700 British troops suffered their worst defeat of the New Zealand Wars at the hands of 230 entrenched Māori warriors in Tauranga.

04-29.title: Jesse James Gang Robs Bank
04-29.description: On April 29, 1872, Jesse James' gang robbed a bank of $1,500 in Columbia, Kentucky, killing a bank employee during the crime.

04-29.title: Easter Rising Ends
04-29.description: On April 29, 1916, Irish republicans abandoned the post office in Dublin and surrendered unconditionally, ending the Easter Rising.

04-29.title: Dachau Concentration Camp Liberated
04-29.description: On April 29, 1945, the U.S. Army liberated 31,601 people from the Dachau Nazi concentration camp in Germany.

04-29.title: Fall of Saigon: U.S. Evacuation Begins
04-29.description: On April 29, 1975, the U.S. began to evacuate its citizens from Saigon in Operation Frequent Wind, bringing an end to U.S. involvement in the Vietnam War.

04-29.title: Berlin Wall Demolition Begins at Brandenburg Gate
04-29.description: On April 29, 1990, wrecking cranes began tearing down the Berlin Wall at the Brandenburg Gate.

04-29.title: Cyclone Strikes Bangladesh
04-29.description: On April 29, 1991, a cyclone struck the Chittagong district in Bangladesh, killing 139,000 people and leaving 10 million homeless.

04-29.title: Chemical Weapons Convention Comes Into Force
04-29.description: On April 29, 1997, the Chemical Weapons Convention of 1993 came into force, outlawing the production, stockpiling, and use of chemical weapons.

04-30.title: Edict of Toleration Ends Christian Persecution
04-30.description: On April 30, 311, Roman Emperor Galerius issued the Edict of Toleration, ending the persecution of Christians in the Roman Empire.

04-30.title: Moorish Invasion of Iberian Peninsula
04-30.description: On April 30, 711, Moorish troops led by Tariq ibn Ziyad landed at Gibraltar to begin their invasion of the Iberian Peninsula.

04-30.title: First French Colonists Arrive in North America
04-30.description: On April 30, 1562, Jean Ribault and a group of colonists arrived in Florida, becoming the first French colonists in North America.

04-30.title: George Washington's Inauguration
04-30.description: On April 30, 1789, George Washington was inaugurated as the first President of the United States at Federal Hall in New York City.

04-30.title: Dickens' 'A Tale of Two Cities' First Published
04-30.description: On April 30, 1859, Charles Dickens' "A Tale of Two Cities" was first published in the literary periodical "All the Year Round."

04-30.title: Chrysler Files for Bankruptcy
04-30.description: On April 30, 2009, the Chrysler automobile company filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy.

05-01.title: Acts of Union Unite Great Britain
05-01.description: On May 1, 1707, the Acts of Union came into force, uniting the Kingdoms of England and Scotland to form the Kingdom of Great Britain.

05-01.title: Carl Linnaeus' 'Species Plantarum' Published
05-01.description: On May 1, 1753, 'Species Plantarum' by Carl Linnaeus was published, marking the formal start date of plant taxonomy adopted by the International Code of Botanical Nomenclature.

05-01.title: World's First Postage Stamp Issued
05-01.description: On May 1, 1840, the 'Penny Black,' the world's first adhesive postage stamp, was issued by the United Kingdom.

05-01.title: U.S. Strikes for 8-Hour Workday
05-01.description: On May 1, 1886, nationwide demonstrations and strikes demanding an 8-hour workday began in the United States.

05-01.title: Daimler and Benz Form Joint Venture
05-01.description: On May 1, 1924, German automobile manufacturers Daimler-Motoren-Gesellschaft and Benz & Cie began their first joint venture, later merging into Mercedes-Benz.

05-01.title: Empire State Building Opens
05-01.description: On May 1, 1931, the Empire State Building opened in New York City, becoming the world's tallest building until the World Trade Center surpassed it in 1970.

05-02.title: Battle of Berlin Ends
05-02.description: On May 2, 1945, the Battle of Berlin ended as the Soviet army stormed the capital, forcing the German commander of the city, General Helmuth Weidling, to surrender.

05-02.title: German Forces Surrender in Italy and Austria
05-02.description: On May 2, 1945, more than 1,000,000 German soldiers officially surrendered to the Western Allies in Italy and Austria.

05-02.title: Arthur Miller Wins Pulitzer Prize
05-02.description: On May 2, 1949, Arthur Miller won a Pulitzer Prize for his play 'Death of a Salesman'.

05-02.title: General Belgrano Sunk in Falklands War
05-02.description: On May 2, 1982, the Argentine cruiser General Belgrano was sunk by the British submarine HMS Conqueror with the loss of more than 350 men during the Falklands War.

05-02.title: Cyclone Nargis Strikes Myanmar
05-02.description: On May 2, 2008, Cyclone Nargis made landfall in Myanmar, killing over 130,000 people and leaving millions homeless.

05-02.title: Osama bin Laden Killed
05-02.description: On May 2, 2011, Osama bin Laden, the mastermind behind the September 11 attacks, was killed by US special forces in Abbottabad, Pakistan.

05-03.title: First Modern European Constitution Proclaimed
05-03.description: On May 3, 1791, the Constitution of May 3 was proclaimed by the Parliament of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth, the first modern constitution in Europe.

05-03.title: Events Depicted in Goya's 'The Third of May'
05-03.description: On May 3, 1808, the events depicted by Spanish painter Francisco Goya in his famous painting 'The Third of May 1808' took place during the Peninsular War.

05-03.title: Britain's First General Strike Begins
05-03.description: On May 3, 1926, Britain's Trade Union Congress called for the country's first-ever general strike in support of striking coal miners, which lasted for 9 days.

05-03.title: Margaret Mitchell Wins Pulitzer for 'Gone with the Wind'
05-03.description: On May 3, 1937, Margaret Mitchell won the Pulitzer Prize for her novel 'Gone with the Wind'.

05-03.title: SS Cap Arcona Sunk by RAF
05-03.description: On May 3, 1945, the German ocean liner SS Cap Arcona, laden with prisoners from concentration camps, was sunk by the Royal Air Force, killing 5,800 people.

05-03.title: Japan's Post-War Constitution Takes Effect
05-03.description: On May 3, 1947, Japan's post-war constitution went into effect, granting universal suffrage and stripping the Emperor of all but symbolic power.

05-04.title: Battle of Tewkesbury
05-04.description: On May 4, 1471, the Battle of Tewkesbury in Gloucestershire was the final battle between the Houses of Lancaster and York, restoring King Edward IV to his throne.

05-04.title: Pope Alexander VI Divides New World
05-04.description: On May 4, 1493, Pope Alexander VI decreed in the papal bull 'Inter caetera' that all lands west of a certain line belonged to Castile, ultimately dividing the Americas between Spain and Portugal.

05-04.title: King Ferdinand VII Returns Spain to Absolutism
05-04.description: On May 4, 1814, King Ferdinand VII of Spain signed the Decree of the 4th of May, returning Spain to absolutism.

05-04.title: U.S. Begins Construction of Panama Canal
05-04.description: On May 4, 1904, the United States began construction of the Panama Canal.

05-04.title: Margaret Thatcher Becomes First Female UK Prime Minister
05-04.description: On May 4, 1979, Margaret Thatcher became the first woman to be elected Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

05-05.title: Kublai Khan Becomes Ruler of Mongol Empire
05-05.description: On May 5, 1260, Kublai Khan, grandson of Genghis Khan, became ruler of the Mongol Empire.

05-05.title: Panic of 1893 Crashes NY Stock Exchange
05-05.description: On May 5, 1893, the Panic of 1893 caused a large crash on the New York Stock Exchange.

05-05.title: Haile Selassie Returns to Ethiopia
05-05.description: On May 5, 1941, Ethiopian Emperor Haile Selassie returned triumphantly to Addis Ababa after its liberation from Italian occupation.

05-05.title: West Germany Granted Full Sovereignty
05-05.description: On May 5, 1955, West Germany was granted full sovereignty by its three occupying powers: the US, UK, and France.

05-05.title: First Large-Scale U.S. Ground Units Arrive in Vietnam
05-05.description: On May 5, 1965, the first large-scale US Army ground units arrived in South Vietnam.

05-05.title: Iranian Embassy Siege in London Ends
05-05.description: On May 5, 1980, the siege at the Iranian Embassy in London ended when the SAS and police stormed the building.

05-05.title: IRA Hunger Striker Bobby Sands Dies
05-05.description: On May 5, 1981, after 66 days on hunger strike, 26-year-old Provisional IRA member and British MP Bobby Sands died in Prison Maze. Nine more hunger strikers died in the next 3 months.

05-06.title: Imperial Troops Sack Rome
05-06.description: On May 6, 1527, Spanish and German Imperial troops sacked Rome, an event which effectively ended the High Renaissance in the city.

05-06.title: Manhattan Island Purchased
05-06.description: On May 6, 1626, Dutch colonist Peter Minuit organized the purchase of Manhattan Island from Native Americans for 60 guilders worth of goods.

05-06.title: Exposition Universelle Opens in Paris
05-06.description: On May 6, 1889, the Exposition Universelle (World's Fair) in Paris opened, with the recently completed Eiffel Tower serving as the entrance arch.

05-06.title: Hindenburg Disaster
05-06.description: On May 6, 1937, the German airship Hindenburg exploded in flames at Lakehurst, New Jersey, killing 35 of the 97 on board and one person on the ground.

05-06.title: Stalin Becomes Premier of the Soviet Union
05-06.description: On May 6, 1941, Joseph Stalin became Premier of the Soviet Union, replacing Foreign Minister Vyacheslav Molotov.

05-07.title: Joan of Arc Breaks Siege of Orléans
05-07.description: On May 7, 1429, the English siege of Orléans was broken by Joan of Arc and the French army.

05-07.title: Alfred Nobel Patents Dynamite
05-07.description: On May 7, 1867, Swedish chemist Alfred Nobel patented dynamite in England.

05-07.title: Pulitzer Prize Plans Approved
05-07.description: On May 7, 1912, Columbia University approved plans to award the Pulitzer Prize in several categories, following its establishment by Joseph Pulitzer.

05-07.title: RMS Lusitania Sunk
05-07.description: On May 7, 1915, the RMS Lusitania was sunk by a German submarine off the southern coast of Ireland, with 1,198 lives lost.

05-07.title: Nazi Germany Surrenders
05-07.description: On May 7, 1945, German General Alfred Jodl signed documents of unconditional surrender to the Allies at Reims, France.

05-07.title: Integrated Circuit Concept Published
05-07.description: On May 7, 1952, the concept of the integrated circuit, the basis for all modern computers, was first published by Geoffrey Dummer.

05-07.title: Emmanuel Macron Wins French Presidency
05-07.description: On May 7, 2017, Emmanuel Macron won France's presidential election, defeating Marine Le Pen.

05-08.title: Charles II Proclaimed King of England
05-08.description: On May 8, 1660, the English Parliament proclaimed Charles II King of England and invited him to return from exile.

05-08.title: Hans Christian Andersen's 'Fairy Tales' Published
05-08.description: On May 8, 1835, the first installment of Hans Christian Andersen's "Fairy Tales" was published in Copenhagen, Denmark.

05-08.title: China Cedes Taiwan to Japan
05-08.description: On May 8, 1895, China ceded Taiwan to Japan under the Treaty of Shimonoseki.

05-08.title: Mount Pelée Erupts on Martinique
05-08.description: On May 8, 1902, Mount Pelée on the island of Martinique erupted, wiping out the city of Saint-Pierre and killing 30,000 people.

05-08.title: V-E Day: World War II Ends in Europe
05-08.description: On May 8, 1945, V-E Day marked the end of World War II in Europe after Germany's General Wilhelm Keitel signed the formal unconditional surrender to the Allies in Berlin.

05-08.title: Smallpox Eradicated
05-08.description: On May 8, 1980, the World Health Organization announced that smallpox had been eradicated.

05-08.title: New Northern Ireland Executive Formed
05-08.description: On May 8, 2007, a new Northern Ireland Executive was formed with Ian Paisley (DUP) as First Minister and Martin McGuinness (Sinn Féin) as Deputy First Minister.

05-09.title: World's Oldest Diplomatic Alliance Ratified
05-09.description: On May 9, 1386, the Treaty of Windsor between Portugal and England was ratified, cementing the oldest diplomatic alliance still in force.

05-09.title: President Johnson Declares End of U.S. Civil War
05-09.description: On May 9, 1865, President Andrew Johnson issued a proclamation declaring that armed resistance in the South was virtually at an end, a commonly accepted end date of the American Civil War.

05-09.title: First Australian Parliament Opens
05-09.description: On May 9, 1901, the first Australian Parliament opened in Melbourne.

05-09.title: Soviet Union Celebrates Victory Day
05-09.description: On May 9, 1945, the Soviet Union celebrated Victory Day to mark the end of World War II in Europe.

05-09.title: U.S. Legalizes the Birth Control Pill
05-09.description: On May 9, 1960, the United States became the first country to legalize the birth control pill.

05-10.title: Amerigo Vespucci's First Voyage
05-10.description: On May 10, 1497, Italian navigator Amerigo Vespucci left for his first voyage to the New World (a disputed claim).

05-10.title: Second Continental Congress Convenes
05-10.description: On May 10, 1775, the Second Continental Congress convened in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, issuing paper currency for the first time.

05-10.title: First Barbary War Begins
05-10.description: On May 10, 1801, the Barbary pirates of Tripoli declared war on the United States, beginning the First Barbary War.

05-10.title: Indian Mutiny Begins
05-10.description: On May 10, 1857, the Indian Mutiny against rule by the British East India Company began with the revolt of Sepoy soldiers in Meerut.

05-10.title: First U.S. Transcontinental Railroad Completed
05-10.description: On May 10, 1869, the Golden Spike was driven, completing the first U.S. Transcontinental Railroad at Promontory Summit, Utah.

05-10.title: Winston Churchill Becomes UK Prime Minister
05-10.description: On May 10, 1940, Winston Churchill succeeded Neville Chamberlain as British Prime Minister at the head of a coalition government.

05-10.title: First Submerged Circumnavigation of the Globe
05-10.description: On May 10, 1960, the U.S. atomic submarine USS Triton completed the first submerged circumnavigation of the globe.

05-10.title: Nelson Mandela Sworn in as President
05-10.description: On May 10, 1994, Nelson Mandela was sworn in as South Africa's first Black president.

05-11.title: Constantinople Becomes Imperial Capital
05-11.description: On May 11, 330, the newly built city of Constantinople was dedicated by Emperor Constantine the Great, becoming the capital of the Eastern Roman Empire.

05-11.title: Third Crusade Departs
05-11.description: On May 11, 1189, Holy Roman Emperor Frederick I Barbarossa and 100,000 crusaders departed Regensburg for the Third Crusade.

05-11.title: Pennsylvania Hospital Founded
05-11.description: On May 11, 1751, the Pennsylvania Hospital was founded by Dr. Thomas Bond and Benjamin Franklin in Philadelphia.

05-11.title: British Prime Minister Spencer Perceval Assassinated
05-11.description: On May 11, 1812, British Prime Minister Spencer Perceval was assassinated by John Bellingham in the lobby of the House of Commons.

05-11.title: Great Dust Bowl Storm
05-11.description: On May 11, 1934, a great dust bowl storm swept across the American and Canadian prairies, traveling as far as the East Coast.

05-11.title: Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty Extended
05-11.description: On May 11, 1995, more than 170 countries agreed to extend the Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty indefinitely and without conditions.

05-11.title: India's Population Reaches 1 Billion
05-11.description: On May 11, 2000, India's population officially reached 1 billion, with baby Astha Arora named as India's symbolic billionth citizen.

05-12.title: William Wilberforce's First Abolition Speech
05-12.description: On May 12, 1789, William Wilberforce made his first major speech on abolition in the UK House of Commons, reasoning the slave trade was morally reprehensible.

05-12.title: Nazi Conquest of France Begins
05-12.description: On May 12, 1940, the Nazi blitzkrieg and conquest of France began with German forces crossing the Meuse River.

05-12.title: Axis Forces in North Africa Surrender
05-12.description: On May 12, 1943, Axis forces in North Africa surrendered to the Allies.

05-12.title: Soviet Union Lifts Berlin Blockade
05-12.description: On May 12, 1949, the USSR lifted its blockade of West Berlin after the successful Berlin Airlift by the Western Allies.

05-12.title: Jimmy Carter Visits Cuba
05-12.description: On May 12, 2002, former US President Jimmy Carter arrived in Cuba, becoming the first U.S. President, in or out of office, to visit since the 1959 revolution.

05-12.title: Wenchuan Earthquake
05-12.description: On May 12, 2008, the Wenchuan earthquake, measuring 7.8 in magnitude, occurred in Sichuan, China, killing over 87,000 people.

05-13.title: Australia's First Fleet Sets Sail
05-13.description: On May 13, 1787, the First Fleet, headed by Arthur Phillip, set sail with 11 ships of convicts for Botany Bay, Australia.

05-13.title: Republic of Ecuador Founded
05-13.description: On May 13, 1830, the Republic of Ecuador was founded with Juan José Flores as president.

05-13.title: Churchill's 'Blood, Toil, Tears and Sweat' Speech
05-13.description: On May 13, 1940, Winston Churchill delivered his famous 'blood, toil, tears and sweat' speech in his first address as Prime Minister to the British House of Commons.

05-13.title: Pope John Paul II Shot
05-13.description: On May 13, 1981, Pope John Paul II was shot and critically wounded by Turkish gunman Mehmet Ali Ağca in St Peter's Square, Vatican City.

05-13.title: Tiananmen Square Hunger Strike Begins
05-13.description: On May 13, 1989, approximately 2,000 students began a hunger strike in Tiananmen Square, China, to force a dialogue with the government.

05-14.title: Delegates Gather for U.S. Constitutional Convention
05-14.description: On May 14, 1787, delegates gathered in Philadelphia to draw up the Constitution of the United States.

05-14.title: Edward Jenner Administers First Smallpox Vaccine
05-14.description: On May 14, 1796, English country doctor Edward Jenner administered his revolutionary cowpox-based vaccine for smallpox in Berkeley, Gloucestershire.

05-14.title: Lewis and Clark Expedition Begins
05-14.description: On May 14, 1804, Meriwether Lewis and William Clark's expedition set out from St. Louis for the Pacific Coast, commissioned by Thomas Jefferson.

05-14.title: Condensed Milk Process Patented
05-14.description: On May 14, 1853, inventor Gail Borden patented his process for making condensed milk.

05-14.title: Israel Declares Independence
05-14.description: On May 14, 1948, David Ben-Gurion declared Israel independent from British administration.

05-14.title: Warsaw Pact Signed
05-14.description: On May 14, 1955, the Warsaw Pact was signed by the Soviet Union and several Eastern Bloc countries.

05-14.title: Google Unveils AI-Powered Search Features
05-14.description: On May 14, 2024, Google unveiled new generative AI features at its annual conference, including AI Overviews at the top of search results.

05-15.title: Pope Innocent IV Authorizes Torture in Inquisition
05-15.description: On May 15, 1252, Pope Innocent IV issued the papal bull Ad Extirpanda, which authorized but also limited the torture of heretics in the Medieval Inquisition.

05-15.title: Kepler Discovers Third Law of Planetary Motion
05-15.description: On May 15, 1618, German astronomer Johannes Kepler discovered the third of his three planetary laws, the 'harmonic law'.

05-15.title: First Emigrant Wagon Train to California Departs
05-15.description: On May 15, 1841, the first emigrant wagon train to reach California left Independence, Missouri, on a 1,730-mile journey over the Sierra Nevada.

05-15.title: National Woman Suffrage Association Forms
05-15.description: On May 15, 1869, the National Woman Suffrage Association was formed in New York, founded by Susan B. Anthony and Elizabeth Cady Stanton.

05-15.title: First McDonald's Restaurant Opens
05-15.description: On May 15, 1940, Richard and Maurice McDonald opened the first McDonald's restaurant in San Bernardino, California.

05-15.title: AT&T Reaches One Million Stockholders
05-15.description: On May 15, 1951, AT&T became the first U.S. corporation to have one million stockholders.

05-15.title: Soviet Union Begins Afghanistan Withdrawal
05-15.description: On May 15, 1988, the Soviet Union began withdrawing its 115,000 troops from Afghanistan.

05-16.title: Japanese Poet Matsuo Bashō Begins Epic Journey
05-16.description: On May 16, 1689, Japanese poet Matsuo Bashō left Edo on his epic journey to Honshu Island, which he wrote about in 'The Narrow Road to the Deep North'.

05-16.title: First Automobile with Internal-Combustion Engine Built
05-16.description: On May 16, 1862, Belgian-French engineer Étienne Lenoir built the first automobile with an internal-combustion engine.

05-16.title: President Andrew Johnson's Impeachment Fails
05-16.description: On May 16, 1868, the U.S. Senate failed to impeach President Andrew Johnson by one vote.

05-16.title: Joan of Arc Canonized
05-16.description: On May 16, 1920, French heroine Joan of Arc was canonized as a saint by Pope Benedict XV.

05-16.title: RAF Begins 'Dambusters' Raid
05-16.description: On May 16, 1943, No. 617 Squadron RAF began the famous Dambusters Raid, bombing German dams in the Ruhr Valley with bouncing bombs.

05-16.title: First Hungarian Jews Reach Auschwitz
05-16.description: On May 16, 1944, the first of over 180,000 Hungarian Jews reached Auschwitz concentration camp.

05-16.title: Soviet and Chinese Leaders End 30-Year Rift
05-16.description: On May 16, 1989, Soviet President Mikhail Gorbachev and Chinese leader Deng Xiaoping met in Beijing, formally ending a 30-year rift.

05-16.title: Human Stem Cells Successfully Cloned
05-16.description: On May 16, 2013, scientists announced that human stem cells had been successfully cloned.

05-17.title: New York Stock Exchange Formed
05-17.description: On May 17, 1792, twenty-four merchants formed the New York Stock Exchange at 70 Wall Street under the Buttonwood Agreement.

05-17.title: Reaping Machine Patented
05-17.description: On May 17, 1803, John Hawkins and Richard French patented the reaping machine.

05-17.title: First Color Photograph Shown
05-17.description: On May 17, 1861, the first color photograph, of a tartan ribbon, was shown by Scottish scientist James Clerk Maxwell to the Royal Institution in London.

05-17.title: Watergate Committee Begins Hearings
05-17.description: On May 17, 1973, the U.S. Senate Watergate Committee began its hearings into the break-in at the Democratic National Committee headquarters.

05-17.title: Massachusetts Legalizes Same-Sex Marriage
05-17.description: On May 17, 2004, Massachusetts became the first U.S. state to legalize same-sex marriage.

05-17.title: Narendra Modi Wins Indian General Election
05-17.description: On May 17, 2014, the BJP, a center-right Hindu nationalist party led by Narendra Modi, won a landslide general election victory in India.

05-18.title: Last Crusader Stronghold of Acre Falls
05-18.description: On May 18, 1291, after 100 years of Crusader control, the last Crusader stronghold of Acre was reconquered and destroyed by the Mamluks.

05-18.title: Napoléon Proclaimed Emperor of France
05-18.description: On May 18, 1804, Napoléon Bonaparte was proclaimed Emperor of France by the French Senate.

05-18.title: Khodynka Tragedy in Moscow
05-18.description: On May 18, 1896, a stampeding crowd on Khodynka Field, Moscow, during coronation festivities for Tsar Nicholas II caused the deaths of an estimated 1,300 people.

05-18.title: India Detonates First Atomic Bomb
05-18.description: On May 18, 1974, India became the sixth nation to detonate an atomic bomb.

05-18.title: Mount St. Helens Erupts
05-18.description: On May 18, 1980, the eruption of Mount St. Helens in Washington state triggered the largest landslide in history, killing 57 people.

05-18.title: Sri Lankan Civil War Ends
05-18.description: On May 18, 2009, the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam were defeated by the Sri Lankan government, ending the Sri Lankan Civil War.

05-19.title: Execution of Anne Boleyn
05-19.description: On May 19, 1536, Anne Boleyn, second wife of English King Henry VIII, was beheaded at the Tower of London on charges of adultery, incest, and treason.

05-19.title: United Colonies of New England Formed
05-19.description: On May 19, 1643, Massachusetts Bay, Plymouth, Connecticut, and New Haven formed the United Colonies of New England.

05-19.title: England Declared a Commonwealth
05-19.description: On May 19, 1649, England was declared a Commonwealth by an act of the Rump Parliament, making England a republic for the next 11 years.

05-19.title: Germany Takes Possession of Cameroon and Togoland
05-19.description: On May 19, 1885, German Chancellor Otto von Bismarck took possession of Cameroon and Togoland.

05-19.title: U.S. Congress Authorizes Postcards
05-19.description: On May 19, 1898, the U.S. Congress passed the Private Mailing Card Act, allowing private publishers and printers to produce postcards.

05-19.title: Turkish War of Independence Begins
05-19.description: On May 19, 1919, Mustafa Kemal Atatürk landed at Samsun on the Black Sea coast, beginning the Turkish War of Independence.

05-20.title: Antioch Earthquake
05-20.description: On May 20, 526, an earthquake in Antioch in the Byzantine Empire (present-day Syria) is estimated to have killed 200,000 people.

05-20.title: Vasco da Gama Arrives in India
05-20.description: On May 20, 1498, Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama arrived in Calicut, India, becoming the first European to reach India by sea.

05-20.title: Shakespeare's Sonnets First Published
05-20.description: On May 20, 1609, William Shakespeare's Sonnets were first published in London by publisher Thomas Thorpe.

05-20.title: Lincoln Signs Homestead Act
05-20.description: On May 20, 1862, US President Abraham Lincoln signed the Homestead Act into law to provide cheap land for the settlement of the American West.

05-20.title: Funeral of King Edward VII
05-20.description: On May 20, 1910, the funeral for Britain's King Edward VII was held in Westminster Abbey, attended by one of the largest assemblies of European royalty.

05-20.title: Charles Lindbergh Begins Transatlantic Flight
05-20.description: On May 20, 1927, Charles Lindbergh took off from New York to cross the Atlantic for Paris in the first solo nonstop transatlantic flight.

05-20.title: Treaty of Jeddah Signed
05-20.description: On May 20, 1927, the Treaty of Jeddah was signed between the United Kingdom and Ibn Saud, recognizing the independence of the forerunner of Saudi Arabia.

05-20.title: Hubble Telescope Sends First Photographs
05-20.description: On May 20, 1990, the Hubble Space Telescope sent its first photographs from space.

05-21.title: Mount Unzen Erupts in Japan
05-21.description: On May 21, 1792, Mount Unzen on Japan's Shimabara Peninsula erupted, creating a tsunami and killing about 15,000 people in the country's deadliest volcanic eruption.

05-21.title: First U.S. Democratic National Convention
05-21.description: On May 21, 1832, the first U.S. Democratic National Convention was held in Baltimore.

05-21.title: Paris Commune's 'Bloody Week' Begins
05-21.description: On May 21, 1871, the French Army attacked Paris, starting the 'Semaine Sanglante' (Bloody Week), which ended the Paris Commune.

05-21.title: Charles Lindbergh Completes Transatlantic Flight
05-21.description: On May 21, 1927, aviator Charles Lindbergh, in the Spirit of St. Louis, landed in Paris after the first solo air crossing of the Atlantic.

05-21.title: Amelia Earhart's Solo Transatlantic Flight
05-21.description: On May 21, 1932, Amelia Earhart landed near Londonderry, Northern Ireland, completing the first solo transatlantic flight by a woman.

05-22.title: Battle of the Granicus
05-22.description: On May 22, 334 BC, the Macedonian army of Alexander the Great defeated Darius III of Persia in the Battle of the Granicus.

05-22.title: First Atlas Published
05-22.description: On May 22, 1570, the first modern atlas, 'Theatrum Orbis Terrarum' (Theatre of the World), was published by Abraham Ortelius in Antwerp.

05-22.title: First Wagon Train Departs for Oregon
05-22.description: On May 22, 1843, the first major wagon train departed Independence, Missouri, for Oregon with 700 to 1,000 migrants.

05-22.title: Germany and Italy Sign 'Pact of Steel'
05-22.description: On May 22, 1939, Germany's Adolf Hitler and Italy's Benito Mussolini signed the 'Pact of Steel,' formalizing the Rome-Berlin Axis.

05-22.title: Thai Military Stages Coup
05-22.description: On May 22, 2014, the Royal Thai Armed Forces staged a coup in Thailand, suspending the constitution and taking control of the government.

05-23.title: Second Defenestration of Prague
05-23.description: On May 23, 1618, two Catholic Lords Regent and their secretary were thrown out of a window in Prague, triggering the Thirty Years' War.

05-23.title: Benjamin Franklin Announces Bifocals Invention
05-23.description: On May 23, 1785, Benjamin Franklin announced his invention of bifocal eyeglasses.

05-23.title: Simón Bolívar Proclaimed 'El Libertador'
05-23.description: On May 23, 1813, South American independence leader Simón Bolívar entered Mérida, Venezuela, and was proclaimed El Libertador (The Liberator).

05-23.title: Bonnie and Clyde Killed
05-23.description: On May 23, 1934, American outlaws Bonnie Parker and Clyde Barrow were killed by police in an ambush near Sailes, Louisiana.

05-23.title: Federal Republic of (West) Germany Created
05-23.description: On May 23, 1949, the Federal Republic of (West) Germany was created from the American, British, and French occupation zones.

05-23.title: Mao Zedong Starts 'Great Leap Forward'
05-23.description: On May 23, 1958, Mao Zedong started the 'Great Leap Forward' movement in China, which led to widespread famine and death.

05-23.title: Good Friday Agreement Accepted in Referendum
05-23.description: On May 23, 1998, the Good Friday Agreement was accepted in a referendum in Northern Ireland with 75% voting yes.

05-24.title: First Printed Library Catalog Appears
05-24.description: On May 24, 1595, the Nomenclator of Leiden University Library appeared, the first printed catalog of an institutional library.

05-24.title: John Wesley's Aldersgate Experience
05-24.description: On May 24, 1738, John Wesley had a spiritual experience that launched the Methodist movement, celebrated annually by Methodists as Aldersgate Day.

05-24.title: First Telegraph Message Sent
05-24.description: On May 24, 1844, Samuel Morse tapped out 'What hath God wrought' in the world's first public telegraph message.

05-24.title: Brooklyn Bridge Opens
05-24.description: On May 24, 1883, the Brooklyn Bridge was opened by President Chester A. Arthur and New York Governor Grover Cleveland.

05-24.title: German Battleship Bismarck Sinks HMS Hood
05-24.description: On May 24, 1941, the German battleship Bismarck sank the British battlecruiser HMS Hood; 1,416 died, and only 3 survived.

05-24.title: Britain Passes Section 28
05-24.description: On May 24, 1988, Britain's Parliament passed Section 28 as law, prohibiting the 'promotion' of homosexuality by local authorities. It was later repealed.

05-25.title: Last Major Plague Outbreak in Europe Begins
05-25.description: On May 25, 1720, the ship 'Le Grand St Antoine' reached Marseille, bringing Europe's last major plague outbreak, which killed around 100,000 people.

05-25.title: May Revolution in Argentina
05-25.description: On May 25, 1810, as part of the May Revolution, citizens of Buenos Aires expelled the Spanish Viceroy Cisneros.

05-25.title: British House of Commons Passes Irish Home Rule Bill
05-25.description: On May 25, 1914, the British House of Commons passed the Irish Home Rule Bill.

05-25.title: First Commercial Fluid Catalytic Cracking Facility Opens
05-25.description: On May 25, 1942, the first commercial fluid catalytic cracking facility began production at Exxon, a process that now produces half the world's gasoline.

05-25.title: JFK Announces Goal of Moon Landing
05-25.description: On May 25, 1961, President John F. Kennedy announced the U.S. goal of putting a man on the Moon before the end of the decade.

05-25.title: George Floyd Murdered
05-25.description: On May 25, 2020, video of George Floyd's arrest and murder while in Minneapolis police custody ignited widespread condemnation and nationwide protests.

05-25.title: Half of U.S. Adults Fully Vaccinated for COVID-19
05-25.description: On May 25, 2021, the U.S. CDC announced that half of all U.S. adults were fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

05-26.title: Dow Jones Industrial Average Begins
05-26.description: On May 26, 1896, the Dow Jones Industrial Average began with an average of 12 industrial stocks, closing at 40.9.

05-26.title: First Major Oil Strike in the Middle East
