10-05.description: On October 5, 1864, most of Calcutta was destroyed by a cyclone, killing approximately 60,000 people.

10-05.title: Weather Warfare Prohibited
10-05.description: On October 5, 1978, over 30 major nations ratified the Environmental Modification Convention, which prohibits widespread, long-lasting, or severe weather warfare.

10-05.title: Chilean Referendum Ends Pinochet's Regime
10-05.description: On October 5, 1988, Chile voted against extending Augusto Pinochet's regime, ending his 16½ years in power.

10-05.title: Overthrow of Slobodan Milošević
10-05.description: On October 5, 2000, mass demonstrations in Belgrade culminated in the resignation of Serbian strongman Slobodan Milošević.

10-06.title: Battle of Passchendaele
10-06.description: On October 6, 1917, during the Third Battle of Ypres, Canadian troops began their assault to recapture the village of Passchendaele from the Germans.

10-06.title: Ashgabat Earthquake
10-06.description: On October 6, 1948, an earthquake in Ashgabat, Turkmen Soviet Socialist Republic, killed an estimated 110,000 people.

10-06.title: First Partial Fossil Skull of Proconsul Africanus Found
10-06.description: On October 6, 1948, paleoanthropologist Mary Leakey found the first partial fossil skull of Proconsul africanus, an ancestor of apes and humans.

10-06.title: Truman Signs Mutual Defense Assistance Act
10-06.description: On October 6, 1949, US President Harry Truman signed the Mutual Defense Assistance Act to strengthen NATO allies.

10-06.title: Stalin Announces Soviet Atomic Bomb
10-06.description: On October 6, 1951, Joseph Stalin announced that the Soviet Union possessed an atomic bomb.

10-06.title: Oral Polio Vaccine Ready for Testing
10-06.description: On October 6, 1956, scientist Albert Sabin announced that his oral polio vaccine was ready for testing.

10-06.title: WHO Recommends First Malaria Vaccine
10-06.description: On October 6, 2021, the WHO recommended the world's first malaria vaccine, Mosquirix, for children after a successful pilot program in Africa.

10-07.title: Battle of Lepanto
10-07.description: On October 7, 1571, at the Battle of Lepanto, the Holy League of Catholic states destroyed an Ottoman fleet in a significant naval defeat off Western Greece.

10-07.title: Deadly Cyclone in Calcutta
10-07.description: On October 7, 1737, a cyclone caused 40-foot waves that are believed to have killed 300,000 in and around Calcutta, India.

10-07.title: Proclamation of 1763 Issued
10-07.description: On October 7, 1763, George III of Great Britain issued the Proclamation of 1763, closing lands in North America north and west of the Alleghenies to white settlement.

10-07.title: KLM, Royal Dutch Airlines, Founded
10-07.description: On October 7, 1919, KLM (Royal Dutch Airlines) was founded in Amsterdam, making it the world's oldest airline still operating under its original name.

10-07.title: U.S. Invasion of Afghanistan Begins
10-07.description: On October 7, 2001, the U.S. invasion of Afghanistan began with an air assault and covert ground operations.

10-07.title: Hamas Launches Major Attack on Israel
10-07.description: On October 7, 2023, Hamas launched a major air and ground attack on Israel from Gaza, killing over a thousand people and taking hundreds of hostages.

10-08.title: Great Stand on the Ugra River
10-08.description: On October 8, 1480, a standoff between Russian and Tatar-Mongol forces at the Ugra River ended with a Mongol retreat, leading to the disintegration of the Golden Horde.

10-08.title: Captain Cook Lands in New Zealand
10-08.description: On October 8, 1769, Captain James Cook landed in New Zealand for the first time. A misunderstanding led to his crew shooting and killing a Māori leader.

10-08.title: Second Opium War Begins
10-08.description: On October 8, 1856, the Second Opium War began with the Arrow Incident on the Pearl River.

10-08.title: Great Chicago Fire
10-08.description: On October 8, 1871, the Great Chicago Fire began, killing an estimated 300 people and destroying much of the city.

10-08.title: Battle of Loos Ends
10-08.description: On October 8, 1915, the Battle of Loos ended as German forces contained the British attack, resulting in 85,000 casualties.

10-08.title: Trotsky Named Chairman of Petrograd Soviet
10-08.description: On October 8, 1917, Leon Trotsky was named chairman of the Petrograd Soviet as Bolsheviks gained control.

10-08.title: Office of Homeland Security Established
10-08.description: On October 8, 2001, US President George W. Bush announced the establishment of the Office of Homeland Security.

10-09.title: Charlemagne Crowned King of the Franks
10-09.description: On October 9, 768, Charlemagne and his brother Carloman I were crowned co-Kings of the Franks.

10-09.title: Leif Erikson Reaches 'Vinland'
10-09.description: On approximately October 9, 1000, Leif Erikson reached 'Vinland' (possibly Newfoundland, Canada), becoming one of the first Europeans in North America.

10-09.title: Korean Hangul Alphabet First Published
10-09.description: On October 9, 1446, the Korean Hangul alphabet was first published by King Sejong the Great.

10-09.title: Roosevelt Approves Manhattan Project
10-09.description: On October 9, 1941, US President Franklin D. Roosevelt approved an atomic program that would become the Manhattan Project.

10-09.title: North Korea Conducts First Nuclear Test
10-09.description: On October 9, 2006, North Korea conducted its first nuclear test with an estimated yield of between 0.4 and 2 kilotons.

10-10.title: Great Hurricane of 1780
10-10.description: On October 10, 1780, the Great Hurricane of 1780 hit Barbados, going on to kill 20,000 to 30,000 people in the Caribbean, the deadliest Atlantic hurricane on record.

10-10.title: Great Chicago Fire Extinguished
10-10.description: On October 10, 1871, the Great Chicago Fire was finally extinguished after three days, leaving approximately 300 dead and 100,000 homeless.

10-10.title: Wuchang Uprising in China
10-10.description: On October 10, 1911, Chinese revolutionaries began an armed rebellion against the ruling Qing dynasty in Wuchang, a key event leading to the Xinhai Revolution.

10-10.title: Ho Chi Minh Enters Hanoi
10-10.description: On October 10, 1954, Ho Chi Minh entered Hanoi after the withdrawal of French troops, consolidating control of North Vietnam.

10-10.title: Windscale Nuclear Accident
10-10.description: On October 10, 1957, a fire at the Windscale nuclear plant in England became the world's first major nuclear accident.

10-11.title: Aleppo Earthquake
10-11.description: On October 11, 1138, an earthquake in Aleppo, Syria, killed an estimated 230,000 people.

10-11.title: Burchardi Flood
10-11.description: On October 11, 1634, the Burchardi flood killed about 15,000 people in North Friesland, Denmark, and Germany.

10-11.title: Calcutta Cyclone (Disputed Account)
10-11.description: On October 11, 1737, an event originally reported as an earthquake that killed 300,000 in Calcutta, India, is now thought to have been a cyclone that killed around 3,000.

10-11.title: Battle of Camperdown
10-11.description: On October 11, 1797, a British fleet decisively defeated a Dutch fleet at the Battle of Camperdown.

10-11.title: Chinese Civil War Begins
10-11.description: On October 11, 1945, the Chinese Civil War resumed between the Kuomintang government and Mao Zedong's Communist Party.

10-11.title: First Man-Made Object to Escape Atmosphere
10-11.description: On October 11, 1945, the WAC Corporal rocket, fired from White Sands Missile Range, became the first man-made object to escape the atmosphere.

10-11.title: Second Vatican Council Convened
10-11.description: On October 11, 1962, the Second Vatican Council was convened by Pope John XXIII, leading to major reforms in the Catholic Church.

10-11.title: Reagan and Gorbachev Meet in Reykjavik
10-11.description: On October 11, 1986, U.S. President Ronald Reagan and Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev opened talks at a summit in Reykjavik, Iceland.

10-12.title: Cyrus the Great Takes Babylon
10-12.description: On October 12, 539 BC, the army of Cyrus the Great of Persia took the city of Babylon.

10-12.title: Dai-Gohonzon Inscribed
10-12.description: On October 12, 1279, Nichiren, a Japanese Buddhist monk and founder of Nichiren Buddhism, inscribed the Dai-Gohonzon.

10-12.title: Christopher Columbus Makes Landfall in the Americas
10-12.description: On October 12, 1492, Christopher Columbus's expedition made landfall on a Caribbean island he named San Salvador, believing he had reached East Asia.

10-12.title: Brazil Invades Uruguay
10-12.description: On October 12, 1864, Brazilian troops invaded Uruguay in a prelude to the War of the Triple Alliance.

10-12.title: First Modern Submarine Commissioned
10-12.description: On October 12, 1900, the first modern submarine, the USS Holland, was commissioned by the U.S. Navy.

10-12.title: Ford Manufactures its 1 Millionth Automobile
10-12.description: On October 12, 1915, the Ford Motor Company manufactured its 1 millionth automobile.

10-12.title: Day of Six Billion
10-12.description: On October 12, 1999, the 'Day of Six Billion' was proclaimed as the estimated day the world population reached 6 billion.

10-13.title: Roman Emperor Claudius Murdered
10-13.description: On October 13, 54, Agrippina the Younger murdered her husband, Roman Emperor Claudius, with poison to secure the succession for her son Nero.

10-13.title: Knights Templar Arrested
10-13.description: On October 13, 1307, French King Philip IV had the Knights Templar arrested and charged with heresy and corruption.

10-13.title: Greenwich Established as Prime Meridian
10-13.description: On October 13, 1884, the International Meridian Conference in Washington, D.C., established Greenwich as the prime meridian of longitude.

10-13.title: Mecca Falls to Saudi Forces
10-13.description: On October 13, 1924, Mecca fell without a struggle to Saudi forces led by Abdulaziz Ibn Saud.

10-13.title: Italy Declares War on Germany
10-13.description: On October 13, 1943, Italy switched sides in World War II and declared war on its former Axis partner, Germany.

10-13.title: Battle of Aachen
10-13.description: On October 13, 1944, the U.S. 1st Army began its attack on Aachen, which would become the first German city captured by the Allies in World War II.

10-13.title: Copiapó Mine Rescue
10-13.description: On October 13, 2010, the Copiapó mining accident in Chile came to a happy end as all 33 miners were rescued after surviving a record 69 days underground.

10-14.title: Battle of Hastings
10-14.description: On October 14, 1066, at the Battle of Hastings, William, Duke of Normandy, defeated the English forces of Harold II, who was killed in the battle.

10-14.title: Battle of Old Byland
10-14.description: On October 14, 1322, Robert the Bruce of Scotland defeated King Edward II of England at the Battle of Old Byland, forcing Edward to accept Scotland's independence.

10-14.title: First Continental Congress Makes Declaration of Colonial Rights
10-14.description: On October 14, 1774, the First Continental Congress made a Declaration of Colonial Rights in Philadelphia.

10-14.title: Paper Strip Photographic Film Patented
10-14.description: On October 14, 1884, George Eastman patented paper-strip photographic film.

10-14.title: Nazi Germany Withdraws from League of Nations
10-14.description: On October 14, 1933, Nazi Germany announced its withdrawal from the League of Nations.

10-14.title: Reagan Proclaims War on Drugs
10-14.description: On October 14, 1982, US President Ronald Reagan proclaimed a 'war on drugs'.

10-15.title: First Ballet Staged in Paris
10-15.description: On October 15, 1581, the first ballet, 'Ballet Comique de la Reine,' commissioned by Catherine de Medici, was staged in Paris.

10-15.title: Gregorian Calendar Introduced
10-15.description: On October 15, 1582, the Gregorian calendar was introduced in Spain, Portugal, and the Papal States, skipping 10 days to sync with the solar year.

10-15.title: Napoleon Bonaparte Begins Exile on Saint Helena
10-15.description: On October 15, 1815, Napoleon Bonaparte arrived on the island of Saint Helena to begin his final exile.

10-15.title: Vietnam War Moratorium Day
10-15.description: On October 15, 1969, millions nationwide protested against the Vietnam War on Moratorium Day in the U.S.

10-15.title: Mandela and de Klerk Awarded Nobel Peace Prize
10-15.description: On October 15, 1993, Nelson Mandela and South African President F. W. de Klerk were jointly awarded the Nobel Peace Prize.

10-16.title: Battle of Leipzig Begins
10-16.description: On October 16, 1813, the Battle of Leipzig began. The largest battle in Europe prior to WWI, it saw Napoleon's forces defeated by Prussia, Austria, and Russia.

10-16.title: Yangtze Agreement Signed
10-16.description: On October 16, 1900, Great Britain and Germany signed the Yangtze Agreement, agreeing to maintain the territorial integrity of China.

10-16.title: Mao Zedong Begins the Long March
10-16.description: On October 16, 1934, Mao Zedong and his troops began their 6,000-mile Long March to evade the Nationalist forces.

10-16.title: Cuban Missile Crisis Begins
10-16.description: On October 16, 1962, the Cuban Missile Crisis began as President John F. Kennedy was shown photos confirming Soviet missiles in Cuba.

10-16.title: Karol Wojtyla Elected Pope John Paul II
10-16.description: On October 16, 1978, Polish Cardinal Karol Wojtyla was elected Pope, taking the name John Paul II.

10-16.title: Augusto Pinochet Arrested in London
10-16.description: On October 16, 1998, former Chilean dictator General Augusto Pinochet was arrested in London on a Spanish warrant for murder charges.

10-17.title: Crimean War: Bombardment of Sevastopol
10-17.description: On October 17, 1854, French and British forces bombarded Sevastopol for the first time during the Crimean War.

10-17.title: First Commercial Transatlantic Wireless Service
10-17.description: On October 17, 1907, Guglielmo Marconi's company began the first commercial transatlantic wireless service.

10-17.title: Burma Railway ('Death Railway') Completed
10-17.description: On October 17, 1943, the Burma Railway, built by Allied POWs and Asian laborers, was completed for use by the Japanese army.

10-17.title: OPEC Begins Oil Embargo
10-17.description: On October 17, 1973, OPEC oil ministers began an oil embargo against nations that had supported Israel in the Yom Kippur War.

10-17.title: ISIS Headquarters in Raqqa Falls
10-17.description: On October 17, 2017, the Islamic State headquarters in Raqqa was declared under full control of the U.S.-led alliance by Syrian Democratic Forces.

10-18.title: Church of the Holy Sepulchre Destroyed
10-18.description: On October 18, 1009, the Church of the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem was destroyed by the Fatimid caliph Al-Hakim bi-Amr Allah.

10-18.title: Louis XIV Revokes Edict of Nantes
10-18.description: On October 18, 1685, French King Louis XIV revoked the Edict of Nantes, canceling the rights of French Protestants (Huguenots).

10-18.title: U.S. Takes Possession of Alaska
10-18.description: On October 18, 1867, the U.S. took formal possession of Alaska from Russia after paying $7.2 million.

10-18.title: Al Capone Convicted of Tax Evasion
10-18.description: On October 18, 1931, gangster Al Capone was convicted of tax evasion and sentenced to 11 years in prison.

10-18.title: Nobel Prize Awarded for DNA Structure Discovery
10-18.description: On October 18, 1962, James Watson, Francis Crick, and Maurice Wilkins won the Nobel Prize for their work in determining the structure of DNA.

10-19.title: Battle of Zama
10-19.description: On October 19, 202 BC, at the Battle of Zama, Hannibal's Carthaginian army was defeated by Roman legions under Scipio Africanus, ending the Second Punic War.

10-19.title: Surrender at Yorktown
10-19.description: On October 19, 1781, British forces under General Charles Cornwallis surrendered to George Washington at Yorktown, effectively ending the American Revolutionary War.

10-19.title: Leon Trotsky Expelled from Politburo
10-19.description: On October 19, 1926, the Russian Politburo expelled Leon Trotsky and his followers.

10-19.title: Streptomycin Isolated
10-19.description: On October 19, 1943, Streptomycin, the first antibiotic remedy for tuberculosis, was isolated by researchers at Rutgers University.

10-19.title: Martin Luther King Jr. Day Established
10-19.description: On October 19, 1983, the U.S. Senate established Martin Luther King Jr. Day as a federal holiday.

10-19.title: Black Monday Stock Market Crash
10-19.description: On October 19, 1987, on 'Black Monday,' stock markets around the world crashed, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average falling by 22%.

10-19.title: Evidence Suggests Life on Earth Began Earlier Than Thought
10-19.description: On October 19, 2015, scientists found evidence that life on Earth may have begun 4.1 billion years ago, 300 million years earlier than previously thought.

10-20.title: First Crusaders Arrive in Antioch
10-20.description: On October 20, 1097, the first Crusaders arrived in Antioch, Ancient Syria, during the First Crusade.

10-20.title: Chinese Uprising in the Philippines Fails
10-20.description: On October 20, 1603, a Chinese uprising in the Philippines failed after 23,000 people were killed.

10-20.title: U.S. Senate Ratifies Louisiana Purchase
10-20.description: On October 20, 1803, the U.S. Senate ratified the Louisiana Purchase.

10-20.title: Suffragette Alice Paul Jailed
10-20.description: On October 20, 1917, U.S. suffragette Alice Paul began a seven-month jail sentence for picketing the White House in support of women's right to vote.

10-20.title: Mao Zedong's Long March Ends
10-20.description: On October 20, 1935, Communist forces ended their Long March at Yan'an in Shaanxi, China, bringing Mao Zedong to prominence.

10-20.title: MacArthur Returns to the Philippines
10-20.description: On October 20, 1944, U.S. forces under General Douglas MacArthur returned to the Philippines, fulfilling his promise, 'I shall return'.

10-20.title: U.S. Sues Google for Antitrust Violations
10-20.description: On October 20, 2020, the U.S. Justice Department sued Google for an illegal monopoly over search and search advertising.

10-21.title: Battle of Trafalgar
10-21.description: On October 21, 1805, at the Battle of Trafalgar, British Admiral Horatio Nelson defeated the combined French and Spanish fleet. Nelson was shot and killed during the battle.

10-21.title: Florence Nightingale Sent to Crimean War
10-21.description: On October 21, 1854, Florence Nightingale, with a staff of 38 nurses, was sent to the Crimean War.

10-21.title: U.S. Troops Capture Aachen
10-21.description: On October 21, 1944, U.S. troops captured Aachen, the first large German city to fall in World War II.

10-21.title: UN Rejects Soviet Atomic Weapons Proposal
10-21.description: On October 21, 1948, the UN rejected a Soviet proposal to destroy all atomic weapons.

10-21.title: Chinese Forces Occupy Tibet
10-21.description: On October 21, 1950, Chinese Communist forces completed their occupation of Tibet.

10-21.title: Aberfan Disaster
10-21.description: On October 21, 1966, 116 children and 28 adults died as a coal waste heap slid and engulfed a school in Aberfan, South Wales.

10-21.title: Failed Military Coup in Burundi
10-21.description: On October 21, 1993, a failed military coup in Burundi led to the assassination of President Melchior Ndadaye and a refugee crisis.

10-22.title: Battle of Liaoluo Bay
10-22.description: On October 22, 1633, at the Battle of Liaoluo Bay, the Dutch East India Company was defeated by Chinese Ming naval forces.

10-22.title: Peter the Great Becomes Emperor of All Russia
10-22.description: On October 22, 1721, Tsar Peter the Great titled himself 'Emperor of All Russia'.

10-22.title: Edison Perfects Carbon Filament Light Bulb
10-22.description: On October 22, 1879, Thomas Edison perfected the carbonized cotton filament light bulb.

10-22.title: Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) Adopted Worldwide
10-22.description: On October 22, 1884, the International Meridian Conference adopted Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) worldwide and created 24 international time zones.

10-22.title: Panic of 1907
10-22.description: On October 22, 1907, a run on the Knickerbocker Trust Company's stock led to a nationwide run on U.S. banks and the Panic of 1907.

10-22.title: Kennedy Addresses Nation on Cuban Missile Crisis
10-22.description: On October 22, 1962, U.S. President John F. Kennedy announced a naval blockade of Cuba in a televised address, marking a major escalation in the Cuban Missile Crisis.

10-23.title: Second Battle of Philippi
10-23.description: On October 23, 42 BC, at the Second Battle of Philippi, Brutus's army was decisively defeated by Mark Antony and Octavian, leading to Brutus's suicide.

10-23.title: First Aerial Reconnaissance Mission Flown
10-23.description: On October 23, 1911, the first aerial reconnaissance mission was flown by an Italian pilot over Turkish lines during the Italo-Turkish War.

10-23.title: Second Battle of El Alamein Begins
10-23.description: On October 23, 1942, British and Allied forces launched a major offensive at El Alamein, Egypt, a turning point in World War II.

10-23.title: 3.4-Billion-Year-Old Fossil Discovered
10-23.description: On October 23, 1977, paleontologist Elso Barghoorn announced the discovery of a 3.4-billion-year-old single-celled fossil, one of the earliest life forms on Earth.

10-23.title: U.S. National Debt Reaches $1 Trillion
10-23.description: On October 23, 1981, the U.S. national debt reached $1 trillion for the first time.

10-23.title: IRA Commences Disarmament
10-23.description: On October 23, 2001, the Provisional Irish Republican Army of Northern Ireland commenced disarmament following peace talks.

10-24.title: Mamluk Sultan Qutuz Assassinated
10-24.description: On October 24, 1260, Qutuz, Mamluk Sultan of Egypt, was assassinated by Baibars, a fellow Mamluk leader who then seized power.

10-24.title: Treaty of Westphalia Ends Thirty Years' War
10-24.description: On October 24, 1648, the Treaty of Westphalia ended the Thirty Years' War in the Holy Roman Empire and recognized Switzerland's independence.

10-24.title: Black Thursday: Stock Market Crash of 1929
10-24.description: On October 24, 1929, 'Black Thursday,' the Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 12.8%, starting the stock market crash of 1929.

10-24.title: Cuban Missile Crisis: Soviet Ships Stop Short of Blockade
10-24.description: On October 24, 1962, Soviet ships approached but stopped short of the U.S. naval blockade of Cuba.

10-24.title: 2008 Financial Crisis: 'Bloody Friday'
10-24.description: On October 24, 2008, during the global financial crisis, many of the world's stock exchanges experienced one of the worst declines in their history.

10-25.title: Battle of Agincourt
10-25.description: On October 25, 1415, at the Battle of Agincourt, Henry V's English forces defeated a larger French army, a victory attributed to the English longbow.

10-25.title: Charge of the Light Brigade
10-25.description: On October 25, 1854, the infamous 'Charge of the Light Brigade' occurred during the Battle of Balaclava in the Crimean War, resulting in over 100 deaths.

10-25.title: Cuban Missile Crisis: 'Until Hell Freezes Over'
10-25.description: On October 25, 1962, U.S. Ambassador Adlai Stevenson demanded the Soviet UN representative answer about Cuban missile bases, saying, 'I am prepared to wait for my answer until hell freezes over.'

10-25.title: UN Expels Taiwan and Admits People's Republic of China
10-25.description: On October 25, 1971, the United Nations voted to expel Taiwan (Republic of China) and admit the People's Republic of China.

10-25.title: Xi Jinping Unveils New Ruling Council
10-25.description: On October 25, 2017, Chinese Premier Xi Jinping unveiled his new ruling council; none of the five new members were considered young enough to be a potential successor.

10-26.title: Northwest Passage Sighted
10-26.description: On October 26, 1850, Robert McClure became the first to sight the fabled Northwest Passage.

10-26.title: Pony Express Ends
10-26.description: On October 26, 1861, the Pony Express mail service ended after 19 months, made obsolete by the completion of the transcontinental telegraph.

10-26.title: Formation of the Red Cross
10-26.description: On October 26, 1863, an international conference began in Geneva aimed at improving medical conditions on battlefields, which led to the formation of the Red Cross.

10-26.title: Last Natural Case of Smallpox
10-26.description: On October 26, 1977, the last natural case of smallpox was discovered in Somalia. The date is considered the anniversary of the eradication of smallpox.

10-26.title: ISIS Founder Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi Killed
10-26.description: On October 26, 2019, a raid by U.S. Special Forces killed ISIS founder and leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi in Syria.

10-27.title: Constantine's Vision of the Cross
10-27.description: On October 27, 312, Roman Emperor Constantine the Great is said to have received his famous Vision of the Cross before the Battle of the Milvian Bridge.

10-27.title: Pinckney's Treaty Signed
10-27.description: On October 27, 1795, Pinckney's Treaty was signed by Spain and the U.S., establishing the southern boundary of the U.S. and giving Americans rights to navigate the Mississippi River.

10-27.title: Cuban Missile Crisis: Black Saturday
10-27.description: On October 27, 1962, 'Black Saturday' during the Cuban Missile Crisis, an American spy plane was shot down over Cuba, bringing the world to the brink of nuclear war.

10-27.title: China's Population Exceeds One Billion
10-27.description: On October 27, 1982, China announced its population had exceeded one billion people.

10-27.title: London's 'Big Bang' Deregulates Financial Markets
10-27.description: On October 27, 1986, the British government deregulated financial markets in a 'Big Bang,' enhancing London's status as a financial capital.

10-28.title: Christopher Columbus Sights Cuba
10-28.description: On October 28, 1492, Christopher Columbus sighted Cuba and claimed it for Spain under the name 'Juana'.

10-28.title: First University in the Americas Established
10-28.description: On October 28, 1538, the first university in the Americas, the Universidad Santo Tomás de Aquino, was established in Santo Domingo.

10-28.title: Lima-Callao Earthquake
10-28.description: On October 28, 1746, the Peruvian cities of Lima and Callao were demolished by an earthquake, killing 18,000.

10-28.title: Michael Faraday Demonstrates Dynamo
10-28.description: On October 28, 1831, Michael Faraday demonstrated his dynamo invention, the first electric generator.

10-28.title: Statue of Liberty Dedicated
10-28.description: On October 28, 1886, the Statue of Liberty was dedicated by President Grover Cleveland, celebrated with New York City's first ticker-tape parade.

10-28.title: Volstead Act Passed, Enforcing Prohibition
10-28.description: On October 28, 1919, the Volstead Act was passed by Congress over President Woodrow Wilson's veto, enabling the enforcement of Prohibition.

10-28.title: 'Taung Child' Fossil Discovered
10-28.description: On October 28, 1924, the 'Taung child' fossil skull was discovered in South Africa. It was later identified as a new hominin species, Australopithecus africanus.

10-29.title: Cyrus the Great Enters Babylon
10-29.description: On October 29, 539 BC, King Cyrus the Great of Persia marched into Babylon, freeing Jewish captives and allowing them to return home.

10-29.title: Conradin, Last Hohenstaufen Heir, Executed
10-29.description: On October 29, 1268, Conradin, the last legitimate male heir of the German Hohenstaufen dynasty, was executed by Charles I of Sicily.

10-29.title: Battle of Mbwila
10-29.description: On October 29, 1665, at the Battle of Mbwila, Portuguese forces defeated the Kingdom of Kongo and decapitated King António I.

10-29.title: Black Tuesday: Stock Market Crash
10-29.description: On October 29, 1929, the stock market crash on Wall Street, known as 'Black Tuesday,' helped trigger the Great Depression.

10-29.title: China Ends One-Child Policy
10-29.description: On October 29, 2015, China announced the end of its one-child policy after 35 years.

10-30.title: Battle of Rio Salado
10-30.description: On October 30, 1340, at the Battle of Rio Salado, Portuguese and Castilian forces defeated a Marinid invasion of the Iberian Peninsula.

10-30.title: Battle of Ladysmith
10-30.description: On October 30, 1899, at the Battle of Ladysmith, the Boers defeated the British, leading to the Siege of Ladysmith during the Second Boer War.

10-30.title: Tsar Nicholas II Issues October Manifesto
10-30.description: On October 30, 1905, Russian Tsar Nicholas II granted civil liberties and accepted the first Duma (Parliament) in the 'October Manifesto'.

10-30.title: Bosphorus Bridge Opens
10-30.description: On October 30, 1973, the Bosphorus Bridge in Istanbul, Turkey, was completed, connecting the continents of Europe and Asia.

10-31.title: Martin Luther Posts Ninety-five Theses
10-31.description: On October 31, 1517, Martin Luther sent his Ninety-five Theses to the Archbishop of Mainz, precipitating the Protestant Reformation.

10-31.title: Michelangelo Finishes 'The Last Judgment'
10-31.description: On October 31, 1541, Michelangelo finished painting 'The Last Judgment' on the altar wall of the Sistine Chapel in Vatican City.

10-31.title: Great Backerganj Cyclone
10-31.description: On October 31, 1876, the Great Backerganj Cyclone ravaged British India (modern-day Bangladesh), killing an estimated 200,000 people.

10-31.title: Balfour Declaration Approved
10-31.description: On October 31, 1917, the British War Cabinet gave final approval to issue the Balfour Declaration, supporting a 'national home for the Jewish people' in Palestine.

10-31.title: Spanish Flu Kills 21,000 in U.S. in One Week
10-31.description: On October 31, 1918, it was reported that the Spanish flu had killed 21,000 people in the U.S. in a single week.

10-31.title: World Population Reaches 7 Billion
10-31.description: On October 31, 2011, the world population reached an estimated 7 billion inhabitants according to the United Nations.

11-01.title: Lisbon Earthquake
11-01.description: On November 1, 1755, a massive earthquake and subsequent tsunami killed more than 50,000 people in Lisbon, Portugal.

11-01.title: Congress of Vienna Opens
11-01.description: On November 1, 1814, the Congress of Vienna opened to redraw the European political map after the defeat of Napoleonic France.

11-01.title: Diphtheria Vaccine Announced
11-01.description: On November 1, 1894, a vaccine for diphtheria was announced by Dr. Émile Roux of Paris.

11-01.title: 'Stupidity or Treason' Speech in Russian Duma
11-01.description: On November 1, 1916, Paul Miliukov delivered the famous 'stupidity or treason' speech in the Russian State Duma, precipitating the downfall of the government.

11-01.title: End of the Ottoman Empire
11-01.description: On November 1, 1922, the Grand National Assembly of Turkey abolished the Ottoman Sultanate, bringing an end to the Ottoman Empire.

11-01.title: First Hydrogen Bomb Test
11-01.description: On November 1, 1952, the U.S. detonated 'Ivy Mike,' the first thermonuclear weapon (hydrogen bomb), in the Marshall Islands.

11-01.title: Maastricht Treaty Comes into Effect
11-01.description: On November 1, 1993, the Maastricht Treaty came into effect, formally establishing the European Union.

11-01.title: Light from Universe's First Stars Detected
11-01.description: On November 1, 2012, scientists detected evidence of light from the universe's first stars, estimated to have formed 500 million years after the Big Bang.

11-02.title: First European to Cross Equatorial Africa
11-02.description: On November 2, 1875, Verney Cameron became the first European to cross equatorial Africa from sea to sea.

11-02.title: Balfour Declaration
11-02.description: On November 2, 1917, the British government proclaimed its support for a Jewish homeland in Palestine in the Balfour Declaration.

11-02.title: Coronation of Haile Selassie I
11-02.description: On November 2, 1930, Ras Tafari Makonnen was crowned Haile Selassie I, Emperor of Ethiopia.

11-02.title: Netherlands Recognizes Indonesian Independence
11-02.description: On November 2, 1949, the Netherlands recognized its former colony Indonesia as a sovereign state.

11-02.title: Cuban Adjustment Act Comes into Force
11-02.description: On November 2, 1966, the Cuban Adjustment Act came into force, allowing 123,000 Cubans the opportunity to apply for permanent residence in the U.S.

11-03.title: Second Muslim Caliph Assassinated
11-03.description: On November 3, 644, the second Muslim caliph, Umar ibn al-Khattab, was mortally wounded in an assassination attempt in Medina.

11-03.title: Act of Supremacy Passed
11-03.description: On November 3, 1534, the English Parliament passed the Act of Supremacy, making King Henry VIII the Head of the Church of England.

11-03.title: Great Patent Granted to Plymouth Colony
11-03.description: On November 3, 1620, the Great Patent was granted to the Plymouth Colony by King James I.

11-03.title: English Long Parliament Forms
11-03.description: On November 3, 1640, the English Long Parliament was convened by King Charles I.

11-03.title: SOS Selected as International Distress Signal
11-03.description: On November 3, 1906, the International Radiotelegraph Conference in Berlin selected 'SOS' as the worldwide standard distress signal.

11-03.title: First Animal to Orbit Earth
11-03.description: On November 3, 1957, the Soviet Union launched Sputnik 2 with the space dog Laika aboard, the first animal to orbit the Earth; she died in flight.

11-03.title: Nixon Promises Gradual Vietnam Troop Removal
11-03.description: On November 3, 1969, US President Richard Nixon promised to gradually withdraw U.S. troops from Vietnam.

11-04.title: Spanish Fury at Antwerp
11-04.description: On November 4, 1576, during the Eighty Years' War, Spanish forces sacked the city of Antwerp.

11-04.title: First Wagon Train Arrives in California
11-04.description: On November 4, 1841, the first emigrant wagon train arrived in California after a five-and-a-half-month journey from Missouri.

11-04.title: First Uniform U.S. Election Day
11-04.description: On November 4, 1845, the first nationally observed uniform election day was held in the United States.

11-04.title: Gatling Machine Gun Patented
11-04.description: On November 4, 1862, American inventor Richard Jordan Gatling patented the hand-cranked Gatling machine gun.

11-04.title: Refrigerating Apparatus Patented
11-04.description: On November 4, 1879, African American inventor Thomas Elkins patented the Refrigerating Apparatus.

11-04.title: Tomb of Tutankhamun Discovered
11-04.description: On November 4, 1922, Howard Carter discovered the intact tomb of Pharaoh Tutankhamun in Egypt's Valley of the Kings.

11-04.title: Barack Obama Elected President
11-04.description: On November 4, 2008, Barack Obama became the first African-American to be elected President of the United States.

11-05.title: Columbus Learns About Maize (Corn)
11-05.description: On November 5, 1492, Christopher Columbus learned how to grow and harvest maize (corn) from Cuba's Indigenous population.

11-05.title: Second Battle of Panipat
11-05.description: On November 5, 1556, the forces of Mughal Emperor Akbar defeated the army of Hindu Emperor Hemu at the Second Battle of Panipat.

11-05.title: Gunpowder Plot
11-05.description: On November 5, 1605, Catholic conspirator Guy Fawkes was arrested for his role in the Gunpowder Plot to blow up King James I and the British Parliament.

11-05.title: Hitler Reveals War Plans
11-05.description: On November 5, 1937, Adolf Hitler informed his military leaders in a secret meeting of his intention to go to war.

11-05.title: Suez Crisis: British and French Land in Egypt
11-05.description: On November 5, 1956, Britain and France landed airborne forces at Port Said in Egypt, escalating the Suez Crisis.

11-05.title: Khomeini Calls U.S. 'The Great Satan'
11-05.description: On November 5, 1979, Supreme Leader of Iran Ayatollah Khomeini described the United States as 'The Great Satan'.

11-06.title: Mexico Declares Independence
11-06.description: On November 6, 1813, the Congress of Chilpancingo formally declared Mexico's independence from Spain.

11-06.title: Abraham Lincoln Elected President
11-06.description: On November 6, 1860, Republican Abraham Lincoln was elected the 16th President of the United States.

11-06.title: Gandhi Arrested in South Africa
11-06.description: On November 6, 1913, civil rights activist M.K. Gandhi was arrested for leading an Indian miners' march in South Africa.

11-06.title: Bolshevik Revolution Begins
11-06.description: On November 6, 1917, the Bolshevik Revolution began with the bombardment of the Winter Palace in Petrograd during the Russian October Revolution.

11-06.title: Shah of Iran Places Country Under Military Rule
11-06.description: On November 6, 1978, Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi of Iran placed the country under military rule.

11-07.title: Ensisheim Meteorite Strikes Earth
11-07.description: On November 7, 1492, the Ensisheim Meteorite struck a wheat field in Alsace, France. It is the oldest meteorite with a known date of impact.

11-07.title: Mary Celeste Sails on Final Voyage
11-07.description: On November 7, 1872, the cargo ship Mary Celeste sailed from Staten Island for Genoa and was mysteriously found abandoned four weeks later.

11-07.title: October Revolution in Russia
11-07.description: On November 7, 1917, during the October Revolution in Russia, Lenin and the Bolsheviks seized power and overthrew the Provisional Government.

11-07.title: Chinese Soviet Republic Proclaimed
11-07.description: On November 7, 1931, the Chinese Soviet Republic was proclaimed by leaders Mao Zedong and Zhu De.

11-07.title: Controversial 2000 U.S. Presidential Election
11-07.description: On November 7, 2000, the U.S. presidential election between George W. Bush and Al Gore was inconclusive; the result was eventually decided by the Supreme Court.

11-07.title: Joe Biden Wins 2020 U.S. Presidential Election
11-07.description: On November 7, 2020, former Vice President Joe Biden was declared the winner of the U.S. presidential race, defeating incumbent President Donald Trump.

11-08.title: Christianity Declared State Religion of Roman Empire
11-08.description: On November 8, 392, Roman Emperor Theodosius I declared Nicene Christianity the state religion.

11-08.title: First Meeting of Moctezuma II and Hernán Cortés
11-08.description: On November 8, 1519, the first meeting between Aztec Emperor Moctezuma II and Spanish Conquistador Hernán Cortés took place in Tenochtitlan, Mexico.

11-08.title: Pennsylvania's Charter of Privileges
11-08.description: On November 8, 1701, William Penn presented the Charter of Privileges, guaranteeing religious freedom for the colony of Pennsylvania.

11-08.title: First Freemasons Lodge in the Netherlands
11-08.description: On November 8, 1734, master cook Vincent La Chapelle formed a Freemasons Lodge in the Netherlands.

11-08.title: Wilhelm Röntgen Discovers X-rays
11-08.description: On November 8, 1895, German physicist Wilhelm Röntgen produced and detected electromagnetic radiation in a wavelength range now known as X-rays.

11-08.title: UN Approves Resolution 1441 on Iraq
11-08.description: On November 8, 2002, the UN Security Council unanimously approved Resolution 1441, forcing Saddam Hussein to disarm or face 'serious consequences'.

11-08.title: First Female President in Africa Elected
11-08.description: On November 8, 2005, Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf was elected president of Liberia, the first woman to lead an African country.

11-08.title: Donald Trump Elected U.S. President
11-08.description: On November 8, 2016, Republican Donald Trump was elected 45th President of the United States, defeating Democrat Hillary Clinton.

11-09.title: Medici Family Loses Power in Florence
11-09.description: On November 9, 1494, Piero the Unfortunate of the de' Medici family, ruler of Florence, lost power and fled the state.

11-09.title: Napoleon Bonaparte Becomes Dictator of France
11-09.description: On November 9, 1799, Napoleon Bonaparte staged a coup and became the dictator of France under the title of First Consul.

11-09.title: Last Tokugawa Shogun of Japan Resigns
11-09.description: On November 9, 1867, Tokugawa Yoshinobu, the 15th and last Tokugawa Shogun in Japan, resigned.

11-09.title: Saddam Hussein Declares Holy War Against Iran
11-09.description: On November 9, 1980, Iraqi President Saddam Hussein declared a holy war (jihad) against Iran.

11-09.title: Fall of the Berlin Wall
11-09.description: On November 9, 1989, East Germany opened its borders, leading to the spontaneous fall of the Berlin Wall as thousands crossed into the West.

11-09.title: Element Darmstadtium Discovered
11-09.description: On November 9, 1994, Darmstadtium, chemical element 110, was discovered at the GSI Helmholtz Centre for Heavy Ion Research in Germany.

11-09.title: Largest Civil Settlement in U.S. History
11-09.description: On November 9, 1998, brokerage houses were ordered to pay $1.03 billion to NASDAQ investors to compensate for price-fixing.

11-09.title: Pfizer Announces Highly Effective COVID-19 Vaccine
11-09.description: On November 9, 2020, drugmakers BioNTech and Pfizer announced their COVID-19 vaccine was over 90% effective in a first look at Phase 3 trial results.

11-10.title: René Descartes's Inspirational Dream
11-10.description: On November 10, 1619, René Descartes had a dream that inspired his 'Meditations on First Philosophy'.

11-10.title: Dutch Cede New Netherland to England
11-10.description: On November 10, 1674, the Dutch Republic formally ceded New Netherland to England, which was renamed New York.

11-10.title: World's First Motorcycle Unveiled
11-10.description: On November 10, 1885, German engineer Gottlieb Daimler unveiled his 'Reitwagen,' the world's first gasoline-powered motorcycle.

11-10.title: WWI Armistice Message Received
11-10.description: On November 10, 1918, a top-secret coded message was received in North Sydney, Nova Scotia, stating that on November 11, all fighting would cease.

11-10.title: 'Lady Chatterley's Lover' Goes on Sale in UK
11-10.description: On November 10, 1960, the uncensored version of D. H. Lawrence's 'Lady Chatterley’s Lover' went on sale in the UK after an obscenity trial.

11-10.title: Demolition of the Berlin Wall Begins
11-10.description: On November 10, 1989, German crowds began demolishing the Berlin Wall, quickly followed by officials with bulldozers.

11-11.title: Mayflower Compact Signed
11-11.description: On November 11, 1620, the Mayflower Compact was signed by Pilgrims at Cape Cod, establishing the first framework of government in what is now the USA.

11-11.title: Gottfried Leibniz Demonstrates Integral Calculus
11-11.description: On November 11, 1675, German mathematician Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz demonstrated integral calculus for the first time.

11-11.title: Jacobite Army Invades England
11-11.description: On November 11, 1745, Bonnie Prince Charlie's Jacobite army invaded England in an attempt to restore the House of Stuart to the British throne.

11-11.title: End of World War I
11-11.description: On November 11, 1918, the World War I Armistice signed by the Allies and Germany came into effect, with hostilities ending at 11 a.m.

11-11.title: Australian Prime Minister Gough Whitlam Removed from Office
11-11.description: On November 11, 1975, Australian Prime Minister Gough Whitlam was removed from office by the Governor-General, Sir John Kerr.

11-11.title: Church of England Approves Ordination of Women
11-11.description: On November 11, 1992, the Church of England approved the ordination of female priests.

11-11.title: Yasser Arafat's Death Confirmed
11-11.description: On November 11, 2004, Yasser Arafat's death from unidentified causes was confirmed by the Palestine Liberation Organization.

11-12.title: Tibetan Troops Occupy Tang Capital Chang'an
11-12.description: On November 12, 764, Tibetan troops occupied Chang'an, the capital of the Chinese Tang Dynasty, for 15 days.

11-12.title: Best-Selling Novel 'Ben-Hur' Published
11-12.description: On November 12, 1880, the best-selling American novel 'Ben-Hur: A Tale of the Christ' by Lew Wallace was published.

11-12.title: Leon Trotsky Expelled from Communist Party
11-12.description: On November 12, 1927, Leon Trotsky was expelled from the Soviet Communist Party, paving the way for Joseph Stalin to consolidate power.

11-12.title: Naval Battle of Guadalcanal Begins
11-12.description: On November 12, 1942, the Naval Battle of Guadalcanal began between Allied and Japanese naval forces in the Solomon Islands.

11-12.title: First 'Space Selfie'
11-12.description: On November 12, 1966, Buzz Aldrin took the first 'space selfie,' a photo of himself performing extravehicular activity during the Gemini 12 mission.

11-12.title: Supreme Court Rules Against Banning Evolution in Schools
11-12.description: On November 12, 1968, the U.S. Supreme Court ruled in Epperson v. Arkansas that laws banning the teaching of evolution in public schools are unconstitutional.

11-12.title: Bhola Cyclone Kills Up to 500,000
11-12.description: On November 12, 1970, the Bhola cyclone made landfall in East Pakistan (now Bangladesh), killing up to 500,000 people, making it the deadliest tropical cyclone ever recorded.

11-12.title: World Wide Web First Proposed
11-12.description: On November 12, 1990, the World Wide Web was first formally proposed by CERN computer scientists Tim Berners-Lee and Robert Cailliau.

11-13.title: Benjamin Franklin on 'Death and Taxes'
11-13.description: On November 13, 1789, in a letter to Jean-Baptiste Le Roy, Benjamin Franklin wrote: 'in this world nothing can be said to be certain, except death and taxes'.

11-13.title: First Modern Sit-Down Strike
11-13.description: On November 13, 1933, the first modern sit-down strike was conducted by Hormel meatpackers in Austin, Minnesota.

11-13.title: Supreme Court Rules Bus Segregation Unconstitutional
11-13.description: On November 13, 1956, the U.S. Supreme Court ruled that racial segregation on buses in Alabama was unconstitutional.

11-13.title: Voyager 1 Sends First Close-up Pictures of Saturn
11-13.description: On November 13, 1980, the U.S. spacecraft Voyager 1 sent back the first close-up pictures of Saturn during its fly-by.

11-13.title: Nevado del Ruiz Volcano Erupts
11-13.description: On November 13, 1985, the Nevado del Ruiz volcano erupted in Colombia, causing a mudflow that killed 25,000 people in the town of Armero.

11-13.title: Trial of 'El Chapo' Begins
11-13.description: On November 13, 2018, the trial of Mexican drug lord Joaquín 'El Chapo' Guzmán began in New York.

11-14.title: Great Comet of 1680 Discovered
11-14.description: On November 14, 1680, Gottfried Kirch discovered the Great Comet of 1680, one of the brightest comets of the 17th century.

11-14.title: Gail Borden Patents Condensed Milk Technology
11-14.description: On November 14, 1856, American inventor Gail Borden was issued a patent for technology related to his invention of condensed milk.

11-14.title: Niagara Falls Power Plant Begins Operation
11-14.description: On November 14, 1896, a power plant at Niagara Falls began operation, harnessing hydroelectric power.

11-14.title: Bolshevik Army Occupies Sevastopol
11-14.description: On November 14, 1920, Russia's Bolshevik army occupied Sevastopol, ending anti-communist attempts to regain control of the government in that region.

11-14.title: Channel Tunnel Public Service Begins
11-14.description: On November 14, 1994, the first public passenger trains ran through the Channel Tunnel, linking England and France.

11-15.title: Columbus's First Recorded Reference to Tobacco
11-15.description: On November 15, 1492, Christopher Columbus noted in his journal the first recorded reference to tobacco.

11-15.title: Berlin Conference Regulates 'Scramble for Africa'
11-15.description: On November 15, 1884, European colonization and trade in Africa were officially regulated at the Berlin Conference, formalizing the 'Scramble for Africa'.

11-15.title: Gillette Safety Razor Patented
11-15.description: On November 15, 1904, King C. Gillette patented the safety razor with disposable blades.

11-15.title: Mackenzie King Retires as Canadian Prime Minister
11-15.description: On November 15, 1948, Mackenzie King retired after over 21 years as Prime Minister of Canada.

11-15.title: Vietnam War Moratorium Demonstration
11-15.description: On November 15, 1969, an estimated 2 million people took part in the Vietnam War Moratorium demonstration across the United States.

11-15.title: PLO Proclaims State of Palestine
11-15.description: On November 15, 1988, a PLO delegation led by Yasser Arafat proclaimed the State of Palestine and recognized the existence of the State of Israel for the first time.

11-15.title: Da Vinci's 'Salvator Mundi' Sells for Record Price
11-15.description: On November 15, 2017, Leonardo da Vinci's painting 'Salvator Mundi' sold for $450.3 million at auction, a record price for any artwork.

11-16.title: Justinian Code Revision Published
11-16.description: On November 16, 534, the second and final revision of the Justinian Code, a codified set of Roman laws, was published.

11-16.title: Pizarro Captures Inca Emperor Atahualpa
11-16.description: On November 16, 1532, Spanish conquistador Francisco Pizarro captured Inca Emperor Atahualpa after a surprise ambush at Cajamarca.

11-16.title: Livingstone First European to See Victoria Falls
11-16.description: On November 16, 1855, Scottish explorer David Livingstone became the first European to see the waterfall he christened Victoria Falls.

11-16.title: UNESCO Founded
11-16.description: On November 16, 1945, the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) was founded.

11-16.title: New Orleans School Desegregation
11-16.description: On November 16, 1960, U.S. Marshals escorted four six-year-old African American girls to previously all-white public schools in New Orleans.

11-17.title: Elizabeth I Ascends English Throne
11-17.description: On November 17, 1558, Elizabeth I, aged 25, ascended the English throne upon the death of her half-sister, Queen Mary I.

11-17.title: Gran Colombia Dissolves
11-17.description: On November 17, 1831, Ecuador and Venezuela separated from Gran Colombia, leading to its dissolution.

11-17.title: Suez Canal Opens
11-17.description: On November 17, 1869, the Suez Canal opened in Egypt, linking the Mediterranean and Red Seas.

11-17.title: Last Ottoman Sultan Expelled
11-17.description: On November 17, 1922, the last sultan of the Ottoman Empire, Mehmed VI, was expelled to Malta on a British warship.

11-17.title: First Patent for Computer Mouse
11-17.description: On November 17, 1970, Douglas Engelbart of the Stanford Research Institute received the first patent for the computer mouse.

11-18.title: First Dated Printed Book in England
11-18.description: On November 18, 1477, 'Dictes and Sayings of the Philosophers,' the first dated book printed in England, was produced by William Caxton.

11-18.title: St. Peter's Basilica Consecrated
11-18.description: On November 18, 1626, St. Peter's Basilica was consecrated in Rome, replacing an earlier basilica and becoming the world's largest Christian church.

11-18.title: Battle of the Somme Ends
11-18.description: On November 18, 1916, British General Douglas Haig finally called off the First Battle of the Somme after more than 1 million soldiers had been killed or wounded.

11-18.title: Jonestown Massacre
11-18.description: On November 18, 1978, in Jonestown, Guyana, 918 members of the Peoples Temple were murdered or committed suicide under cult leader Jim Jones.

11-18.title: South Africa Approves New Democratic Constitution
11-18.description: On November 18, 1993, Black and white leaders in South Africa approved a new democratic constitution, paving the way for the end of apartheid.

11-19.title: Diet of Augsburg Final Decree
11-19.description: On November 19, 1530, the final decree of the Diet of Augsburg was signed, reaffirming Catholic principles in the Holy Roman Empire.

11-19.title: Mayflower Reaches Cape Cod
11-19.description: On November 19, 1620, the Mayflower reached Cape Cod and the Pilgrims began to explore the coast.

11-19.title: Lewis and Clark Expedition Reaches Pacific Ocean
11-19.description: On November 19, 1805, the Lewis and Clark Expedition reached the Pacific Ocean, becoming the first European Americans to cross the West.

11-19.title: Lincoln Delivers Gettysburg Address
11-19.description: On November 19, 1863, US President Abraham Lincoln delivered his Gettysburg Address, beginning with 'Four score and seven years ago...'

11-19.title: Battle of Stalingrad: Operation Uranus Begins
11-19.description: On November 19, 1942, the Soviet offensive Operation Uranus began, encircling the German Sixth Army at Stalingrad.

11-19.title: Apollo 12 Lands on the Moon
11-19.description: On November 19, 1969, Apollo 12's Charles Conrad and Alan Bean became the 3rd and 4th humans to walk on the Moon.

11-19.title: Reagan and Gorbachev Meet for First Time
11-19.description: On November 19, 1985, US President Ronald Reagan and Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev met for the first time at a summit in Geneva.

11-20.title: Diocletian Proclaimed Roman Emperor
11-20.description: On November 20, 284, Roman General Diocletian was proclaimed emperor by his armies.

11-20.title: Uyghur Khan Conquers Luoyang
11-20.description: On November 20, 762, the Khan of the Uyghurs, Bögü Qaghan, conquered Luoyang, the eastern capital of the Chinese Empire.

11-20.title: Zumbi, Last King of Palmares, Executed
11-20.description: On November 20, 1695, Zumbi, the last king of the Quilombo dos Palmares in Brazil and a former slave, was executed and decapitated.

11-20.title: Second Treaty of Paris Signed
11-20.description: On November 20, 1815, the Second Treaty of Paris was signed, reducing France's borders to those of 1790 and ending the Napoleonic Wars.

11-20.title: Nuremberg Trials Begin
11-20.description: On November 20, 1945, the Nuremberg trials began as 24 Nazi leaders were put on trial before judges representing the victorious Allied powers.

11-20.title: WHO Announces First Global Effort to Combat AIDS
11-20.description: On November 20, 1986, the World Health Organization announced the first global effort to combat AIDS.

11-21.title: Hanukkah Story: Temple Rededication
11-21.description: On November 21, 164 BC, Judas Maccabeus recaptured Jerusalem and rededicated the Second Temple, an event commemorated as the Jewish festival of Hanukkah.

11-21.title: China Prohibits Opium Trade
11-21.description: On November 21, 1906, China prohibited the opium trade.

11-21.title: Hafez al-Assad Becomes Prime Minister of Syria
11-21.description: On November 21, 1970, General Hafez al-Assad became Prime Minister of Syria following a military coup.

11-21.title: Battle of Garibpur
11-21.description: On November 21, 1971, at the Battle of Garibpur, Indian troops aided by Bengali guerrillas defeated the army of Pakistan.

11-21.title: Robert Mugabe Resigns
11-21.description: On November 21, 2017, Robert Mugabe's resignation after 37 years in power was read out in Zimbabwe's parliament during impeachment proceedings.

11-22.title: Vasco da Gama Rounds Cape of Good Hope
11-22.description: On November 22, 1497, Portuguese navigator Vasco da Gama rounded the Cape of Good Hope on the first voyage from Europe to India.

11-22.title: Clipper Ship Cutty Sark Launched
11-22.description: On November 22, 1869, the clipper ship Cutty Sark was launched in Dumbarton, Scotland. It is the only one of its kind still surviving.

11-22.title: Imperial Conference Grants Autonomy
11-22.description: On November 22, 1926, the Imperial Conference ended, with the Balfour Declaration granting autonomy within the British Commonwealth.

11-22.title: First Trans-Pacific Airmail Flight
11-22.description: On November 22, 1935, the flying boat 'China Clipper' took off from California on the first trans-Pacific airmail flight.

11-22.title: Assassination of John F. Kennedy
11-22.description: On November 22, 1963, while riding in an open motorcade in Dallas, Texas, US President John F. Kennedy was assassinated by Lee Harvey Oswald.

11-22.title: First Isolation of a Single Gene
11-22.description: On November 22, 1969, the first isolation of a single gene was announced by scientists at Harvard University.

11-22.title: Angela Merkel Becomes First Female Chancellor of Germany
11-22.description: On November 22, 2005, Angela Merkel became the first female Chancellor of Germany.

11-23.title: Conquest of Seville
11-23.description: On November 23, 1248, the city of Seville was conquered by Christian troops under King Ferdinand III of Castile.

11-23.title: John Milton's 'Areopagitica' Published
11-23.description: On November 23, 1644, 'Areopagitica,' a pamphlet by John Milton decrying censorship, was published.

11-23.title: Process for Color Photography Patented
11-23.description: On November 23, 1868, Louis Ducos du Hauron patented a process for making color photographs in Paris, France.

11-23.title: U.S. Federal Climate Report Released
11-23.description: On November 23, 2018, a U.S. Federal Climate report estimated that climate change would reduce the economy by 10% by 2100.

11-23.title: Sumatran Rhino Declared Extinct in Malaysia
11-23.description: On November 23, 2019, the Sumatran rhino was officially declared extinct in Malaysia after the last known specimen died.

11-24.title: Theodosius I Enters Constantinople
11-24.description: On November 24, 380, Theodosius I made his 'adventus,' or first formal entry, into Constantinople as Roman Emperor.

11-24.title: First Recorded Observation of Venus Transit
11-24.description: On November 24, 1639, English astronomers Jeremiah Horrocks and William Crabtree made the first recorded observations of a transit of Venus.

11-24.title: First European Discovery of Tasmania
11-24.description: On November 24, 1642, Dutch explorer Abel Tasman became the first European to discover Van Diemen's Land (now Tasmania).

11-24.title: Darwin Publishes 'On the Origin of Species'
11-24.description: On November 24, 1859, English naturalist Charles Darwin published 'On the Origin of Species,' laying the foundation for evolutionary biology.

11-24.title: UN 'Home by Christmas' Offensive in Korea
11-24.description: On November 24, 1950, UN troops began an assault intended to end the Korean War by Christmas.

11-24.title: 'Lucy' Skeleton Discovered
11-24.description: On November 24, 1974, the most complete early human skeleton, 'Lucy' (Australopithecus), was discovered in Ethiopia.

11-25.title: Battle of Montgisard
11-25.description: On November 25, 1177, at the Battle of Montgisard, the Crusader Kingdom of Jerusalem under Baldwin IV defeated a larger army led by Saladin.

11-25.title: Britain Evacuates New York City
11-25.description: On November 25, 1783, Britain evacuated New York City, its last military position in the United States, following the end of the Revolutionary War.

11-25.title: India Cyclone Kills 300,000
11-25.description: On November 25, 1839, a cyclone slammed southeastern India with high winds and a 40-foot storm surge, killing an estimated 300,000 people.

11-25.title: First Advertisement for a Radio Set
11-25.description: On November 25, 1905, the first advertisement for a radio set, a telegraph transmitter with a one-mile range, appeared in 'Scientific American' for $8.50.

11-25.title: Iran-Contra Affair Erupts
11-25.description: On November 25, 1986, the Iran-Contra affair erupted as President Reagan revealed a secret arms-for-hostages deal with Iran.

11-26.title: Second Triumvirate Alliance Formed
11-26.description: On November 26, 43 BC, the Second Triumvirate alliance of Roman leaders was formed by Octavian, Marcus Aemilius Lepidus, and Mark Antony.

11-26.title: Captain Cook Visits Maui
11-26.description: On November 26, 1778, British explorer Captain James Cook became the first European to visit Maui in the Sandwich Islands (now Hawaii).

11-26.title: First National Thanksgiving in the U.S.
11-26.description: On November 26, 1789, the first national Thanksgiving was observed in the U.S. as proclaimed by President George Washington.

11-26.title: First U.S. Cabinet Meeting
11-26.description: On November 26, 1791, the first U.S. cabinet meeting was held at George Washington's home in Philadelphia.

11-26.title: 'Alice in Wonderland' Published in America
11-26.description: On November 26, 1865, 'Alice in Wonderland' by Lewis Carroll was published in America.

11-26.title: Tutankhamun's Tomb Opened
11-26.description: On November 26, 1922, English archaeologist Howard Carter and his team opened the nearly intact tomb of Tutankhamun in Egypt.

11-27.title: Pope Urban II Calls for First Crusade
11-27.description: On November 27, 1095, Pope Urban II preached to the West to wrest control of the Holy Land from the Seljuk Turks, triggering the First Crusade.

11-27.title: 'The Model Parliament' Convened
11-27.description: On November 27, 1295, English King Edward I called what later became known as 'The Model Parliament,' extending representation beyond the nobility.

11-27.title: La Navidad Colony Destroyed
11-27.description: On November 27, 1493, Christopher Columbus returned to the colony of La Navidad to find it destroyed by the first Native American uprising against Spanish rule.

11-27.title: Portuguese Royal Family Flees to Brazil
11-27.description: On November 27, 1807, the Portuguese Royal Family and its court fled Lisbon for their colony of Brazil to escape invading Napoleonic troops.

11-27.title: Alfred Nobel Establishes Nobel Prizes
11-27.description: On November 27, 1895, Swedish chemist Alfred Nobel established the Nobel Prizes through his will.

11-28.title: Magellan Begins Crossing the Pacific
11-28.description: On November 28, 1520, Portuguese navigator Ferdinand Magellan began crossing the Pacific Ocean, the first European to do so.

11-28.title: First Steam-Powered Printing Press
11-28.description: On November 28, 1814, The Times of London was first printed by automatic, steam-powered presses, making newspapers available to a mass audience.

11-28.title: New Zealand Women Vote for First Time
11-28.description: On November 28, 1893, New Zealand women voted for the first time in a national election.

11-28.title: First Female Member of British House of Commons
11-28.description: On November 28, 1919, American-born Lady Nancy Astor was elected as the first female member of the British House of Commons to take her seat.

11-28.title: First Radio Pulsars Detected
11-28.description: On November 28, 1967, the first radio pulsars were detected by postgraduate student Jocelyn Bell Burnell and her supervisor Antony Hewish.

11-29.title: Thomas Edison Demonstrates Phonograph
11-29.description: On November 29, 1877, U.S. inventor Thomas Edison demonstrated his hand-cranked phonograph for the first time.

11-29.title: First U.S. Patent for Traffic Light System
11-29.description: On November 29, 1910, the first U.S. patent for a traffic light system was issued to Ernest Sirrine.

11-29.title: Schrödinger Publishes 'Schrödinger's Cat' Paradox
11-29.description: On November 29, 1935, physicist Erwin Schrödinger published his famous thought experiment, 'Schrödinger's cat'.

11-29.title: First Underground Atomic Explosion
11-29.description: On November 29, 1951, the first underground atomic explosion was conducted at Frenchman Flat, Nevada.

11-29.title: First Regular NY to LA Commercial Air Service
11-29.description: On November 29, 1959, American Airlines began the first regular commercial New York to Los Angeles nonstop jet service.

11-29.title: Education for All Handicapped Children Act Signed
11-29.description: On November 29, 1975, US President Gerald Ford signed the Education for All Handicapped Children Act, requiring states to provide free education for children with disabilities.

11-30.title: Cnut the Great Claims English Throne
11-30.description: On November 30, 1016, Cnut the Great, King of Denmark, claimed the English throne after the death of Edmund Ironside.

11-30.title: German Beer Purity Law (Reinheitsgebot)
11-30.description: On November 30, 1487, the first German Beer Purity Law (Reinheitsgebot) was promulgated in Munich, stating that beer should be brewed from only water, malt, and hops.

11-30.title: Tuscany Becomes First State to Abolish Death Penalty
11-30.description: On November 30, 1786, Tuscany became the first modern state to abolish the death penalty.

11-30.title: Mask of Agamemnon Discovered
11-30.description: On November 30, 1876, archaeologist Heinrich Schliemann discovered the gold 'Mask of Agamemnon' at Mycenae in modern Greece.

11-30.title: British House of Lords Rejects 'People's Budget'
11-30.description: On November 30, 1909, the British House of Lords rejected David Lloyd George's 'People's Budget,' leading to a constitutional crisis.

12-01.title: Ford Institutes First Moving Assembly Line
12-01.description: On December 1, 1913, the Ford Motor Company instituted the world's first moving assembly line for the Model T Ford.

12-01.title: Stalin Begins Great Purge
12-01.description: On December 1, 1934, Leningrad mayor Sergei Kirov was assassinated, an event Joseph Stalin used as an excuse to begin his Great Purge.

12-01.title: Rosa Parks Arrested
12-01.description: On December 1, 1955, Rosa Parks was arrested for refusing to give up her seat to a white passenger on a bus in Montgomery, Alabama.

12-01.title: Channel Tunnel Breakthrough
12-01.description: On December 1, 1990, British and French workers met in the middle of the Channel Tunnel, 40 meters under the English Channel, linking Britain to mainland Europe.

12-02.title: Coronation of Napoleon Bonaparte
12-02.description: On December 2, 1804, Napoleon Bonaparte was crowned Emperor of the French at Notre Dame de Paris.

12-02.title: Monroe Doctrine Declared
12-02.description: On December 2, 1823, US President James Monroe declared the 'Monroe Doctrine,' opposing European colonialism in the Americas.

12-02.title: President Polk Promotes 'Manifest Destiny'
12-02.description: On December 2, 1845, US President James K. Polk announced to Congress that the United States should aggressively expand into the West, a belief known as 'manifest destiny'.

12-02.title: First 'Peking Man' Skull Found
12-02.description: On December 2, 1929, the first skull of 'Peking Man' was found in caves outside of Peking, China, and was later dated to be roughly 750,000 years old.

12-02.title: Fidel Castro Becomes President of Cuba
12-02.description: On December 2, 1976, communist revolutionary Fidel Castro became President of Cuba.

12-02.title: Benazir Bhutto Becomes Prime Minister of Pakistan
12-02.description: On December 2, 1988, Benazir Bhutto became Prime Minister of Pakistan, the first female leader of a Muslim country.

12-03.title: Eureka Stockade Uprising
12-03.description: On December 3, 1854, in what is often called the birth of Australian democracy, more than 20 gold miners at Ballarat, Victoria, were killed by state troopers in an uprising over mining licences.

12-03.title: World's First Human-to-Human Heart Transplant
12-03.description: On December 3, 1967, South African surgeon Dr. Christiaan Barnard performed the world's first human-to-human heart transplant.

12-03.title: Bhopal Disaster
12-03.description: On December 3, 1984, a Union Carbide pesticide plant in Bhopal, India, leaked toxic gas, killing thousands in one of the world's worst industrial disasters.

12-03.title: Cold War Declared Over
12-03.description: On December 3, 1989, Soviet President Mikhail Gorbachev and US President George H. W. Bush declared the Cold War over at the Malta Summit.

12-04.title: Ottomans Occupy Baghdad
12-04.description: On December 4, 1534, Ottoman Sultan Suleiman the Magnificent occupied Baghdad.

12-04.title: Council of Trent's Last Session
12-04.description: On December 4, 1563, the Council of Trent held its last session after 18 years.

12-04.title: First Thanksgiving in the Americas (Berkeley Hundred)
12-04.description: On December 4, 1619, thirty-eight colonists from Berkeley Parish, England, disembarked in Virginia and gave thanks to God, an event considered by some as the first Thanksgiving in the Americas.

12-04.title: First Issue of The Observer
12-04.description: On December 4, 1791, Britain's 'The Observer' was first published, becoming the world's oldest Sunday newspaper.

12-04.title: Britain Outlaws Suttee in India
12-04.description: On December 4, 1829, Britain outlawed 'suttee' in India, a Hindu practice where a widow burns herself to death on her husband's funeral pyre.

12-04.title: Woodrow Wilson Sails for Versailles Peace Conference
12-04.description: On December 4, 1918, US President Woodrow Wilson sailed for the Versailles Peace Conference in France, becoming the first sitting president to travel to Europe.

12-05.title: Charlemagne Becomes Sole King of the Franks
12-05.description: On December 5, 771, Charlemagne became the sole King of the Franks after the death of his brother and co-ruler, Carloman.

12-05.title: Nuremberg Pogrom During Black Death
12-05.description: On December 5, 1349, 562 Jews of Nuremberg were massacred during Black Death riots.

12-05.title: Naples Earthquake
12-05.description: On December 5, 1456, an earthquake struck Naples, killing an estimated 35,000 people.

12-05.title: California Gold Rush Triggered
12-05.description: On December 5, 1848, US President James K. Polk confirmed a gold discovery in California, triggering the Gold Rush of 1849.

12-05.title: Prohibition Ends in the United States
12-05.description: On December 5, 1933, Prohibition ended in the U.S. when the 21st Amendment to the Constitution was ratified, repealing the 18th Amendment.

12-05.title: ARPANET Network Established
12-05.description: On December 5, 1969, a four-node ARPANET network was established, a key milestone in the development of the internet.

12-06.title: Mongol Siege of Kyiv
12-06.description: On December 6, 1240, Mongols led by Batu Khan occupied and destroyed Kyiv; out of 50,000 people in the city, only 2,000 survived.

12-06.title: 13th Amendment Ratified, Abolishing Slavery
12-06.description: On December 6, 1865, the 13th Amendment to the United States Constitution was ratified, abolishing slavery.

12-06.title: Thomas Edison Records His Voice
12-06.description: On December 6, 1877, Thomas Edison demonstrated his phonograph by recording and playing back his own voice reciting 'Mary Had a Little Lamb'.

12-06.title: Anglo-Irish Treaty Signed
12-06.description: On December 6, 1921, the Anglo-Irish Treaty was signed, granting Ireland dominion status and creating Northern Ireland.

12-06.title: Hugo Chávez Elected President of Venezuela
12-06.description: On December 6, 1998, Hugo Chávez was elected President of Venezuela for the first time.

12-06.title: NASA Suggests Presence of Liquid Water on Mars
12-06.description: On December 6, 2006, NASA revealed photographs taken by the Mars Global Surveyor that suggested the presence of liquid water on Mars.

12-07.title: Cicero Assassinated
12-07.description: On December 7, 43 BC, Roman orator and politician Marcus Tullius Cicero was assassinated by soldiers under the command of Mark Antony.

12-07.title: First Thermosetting Plastic Patented
12-07.description: On December 7, 1909, inventor Leo Baekeland patented the first thermosetting plastic, Bakelite, sparking the birth of the plastics industry.

12-07.title: Attack on Pearl Harbor
12-07.description: On December 7, 1941, the Imperial Japanese Navy attacked the US fleet at Pearl Harbor, Hawaii, killing 2,403 people and leading to the U.S. entry into WWII.

12-07.title: Catholic and Orthodox Churches Lift Mutual Excommunications
12-07.description: On December 7, 1965, Pope Paul VI and Patriarch Athenagoras I simultaneously lifted the mutual excommunications that led to the Great Schism of 1054.

12-07.title: Spitak Earthquake in Armenia
12-07.description: On December 7, 1988, a 6.9 magnitude earthquake in Spitak, Armenia, killed between 25,000 and 50,000 people.

12-07.title: China Ends Zero-COVID Policy
12-07.description: On December 7, 2022, after widespread public protests, China announced a major loosening of COVID-19 restrictions, effectively ending its zero-COVID policy.

12-08.title: Lincoln's Plan for Reconstruction
12-08.description: On December 8, 1863, Abraham Lincoln issued his Amnesty Proclamation and plan for the Reconstruction of the South.

12-08.title: U.S. and Britain Declare War on Japan
12-08.description: On December 8, 1941, the day after the Pearl Harbor attack, the U.S. and Britain declared war on Japan, officially entering World War II.

12-08.title: FDR’s 'Day of Infamy' Speech
12-08.description: On December 8, 1941, US President Franklin D. Roosevelt delivered his famous 'Day of Infamy' speech to a joint session of Congress.

12-08.title: Second Vatican Council Closes
12-08.description: On December 8, 1965, Pope Paul VI closed the final session of the Second Vatican Council, which had significantly modernized Catholic Church practices.

12-08.title: Outer Space Treaty Agreement
12-08.description: On December 8, 1966, the U.S. and USSR reached an agreement on the Outer Space Treaty, prohibiting nuclear weapons in outer space.

12-08.title: Union of South American Nations Established
12-08.description: On December 8, 2004, the Cuzco Declaration was signed in Cuzco, Peru, establishing the Union of South American Nations.

12-08.title: Syrian Dictator Bashar al-Assad Overthrown
12-08.description: On December 8, 2024, Syrian dictator Bashar al-Assad fled to Moscow after rebel forces swept into the capital, Damascus, ending his family's decades-long rule.

12-09.title: Byzantine General Belisarius Enters Rome
12-09.description: On December 9, 536, Byzantine general Belisarius entered Rome while the Ostrogothic garrison peacefully left, returning the old capital to the Byzantine Empire.

12-09.title: Frederick II Crowned King of Germany
12-09.description: On December 9, 1212, Frederick II, later Holy Roman Emperor, was crowned King of Germany in Mainz.

12-09.title: 'The Mother of All Demos'
12-09.description: On December 9, 1968, Douglas Engelbart demonstrated for the first time the computer mouse, word processing, windows, and other modern computing concepts in 'The Mother of All Demos'.

12-09.title: Lech Wałęsa Wins Poland's First Presidential Election
12-09.description: On December 9, 1990, Solidarity leader Lech Wałęsa won Poland's first direct presidential election.

12-09.title: Operation Restore Hope in Somalia
12-09.description: On December 9, 1992, U.S. Marines and allied nations launched Operation Restore Hope in Mogadishu, Somalia, to restore order and provide humanitarian aid.

12-10.title: Martin Luther Burns Papal Bull
12-10.description: On December 10, 1520, Martin Luther publicly burned Pope Leo X's papal bull, which had demanded that Luther recant his writings.

12-10.title: Newton's Derivation of Kepler's Laws Presented
12-10.description: On December 10, 1684, Isaac Newton's derivation of Kepler's laws from his theory of gravity was read to the Royal Society by Edmond Halley.

12-10.title: Metric System First Adopted in France
12-10.description: On December 10, 1799, the metric system was first officially adopted in France.

12-10.title: First Nobel Peace Prizes Awarded
12-10.description: On December 10, 1901, the first Nobel Peace Prizes were awarded to Red Cross co-founder Henry Dunant and peace activist Frédéric Passy.

12-10.title: King Edward VIII Abdicates
12-10.description: On December 10, 1936, King Edward VIII signed the Instrument of Abdication, giving up the British throne to marry American divorcée Wallis Simpson.

12-10.title: Martin Luther King Jr. Receives Nobel Peace Prize
12-10.description: On December 10, 1964, the Nobel Peace Prize was presented to Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. in Oslo, Norway.

12-11.title: Last Native Prince of Wales Killed
12-11.description: On December 11, 1282, Llywelyn ap Gruffydd, the last native Prince of Wales, was killed in battle by forces of Edward I of England.

12-11.title: Mayflower Pilgrims Come Ashore at Plymouth
12-11.description: On December 11, 1620 (Old Style), the Mayflower Pilgrims came ashore in Plymouth Bay, Massachusetts.

12-11.title: Trial of King Louis XVI Begins
12-11.description: On December 11, 1792, French King Louis XVI went on trial, accused of high treason and crimes against the state.

12-11.title: Mona Lisa Recovered
12-11.description: On December 11, 1913, the iconic painting the 'Mona Lisa' was recovered two years after it was stolen from the Louvre Museum.

12-11.title: Statute of Westminster Grants Legislative Independence
12-11.description: On December 11, 1931, the Statute of Westminster granted complete legislative independence to the dominions of the British Empire.

12-11.title: UNICEF Established
12-11.description: On December 11, 1946, the United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund (UNICEF) was established.

12-11.title: Kyoto Protocol Adopted
12-11.description: On December 11, 1997, delegates at a UN climate conference in Kyoto, Japan, reached an agreement to control greenhouse gas emissions.

12-12.title: Battle of Nineveh
12-12.description: On December 12, 627, the Byzantine army under Emperor Heraclius heavily defeated Persian forces at the Battle of Nineveh.

12-12.title: Pahlavi Dynasty Begins in Iran
12-12.description: On December 12, 1925, the Constituent Assembly of Iran amended the constitution, officially overthrowing the Qajar dynasty and bestowing the crown upon Reza Shah Pahlavi.

12-12.title: UN Accepts Land for Headquarters
12-12.description: On December 12, 1946, the United Nations accepted six Manhattan blocks as a gift from John D. Rockefeller Jr. for its headquarters.

12-12.title: Kenya Becomes a Republic
12-12.description: On December 12, 1964, Kenya became an independent republic with Jomo Kenyatta as its first president.

12-12.title: Supreme Court Decides Bush v. Gore
12-12.description: On December 12, 2000, the U.S. Supreme Court issued its decision in Bush v. Gore, resolving the 2000 presidential election in George W. Bush's favor.

12-12.title: Paris Agreement on Climate Change Reached
12-12.description: On December 12, 2015, the COP21 climate change summit in Paris reached an agreement between 195 countries to limit the rise in global average temperature.

12-12.title: Boris Johnson's Conservative Party Wins UK Election
12-12.description: On December 12, 2019, the British general election was won by Boris Johnson's Conservative Party in a landslide victory.

12-13.title: Francis Drake Begins Circumnavigation
12-13.description: On December 13, 1577, Francis Drake set sail from England on an epic three-year circumnavigation of the world.

12-13.title: U.S. National Guard Founded
12-13.description: On December 13, 1636, the Massachusetts Bay Colony organized three militia regiments, an event now recognized as the founding of the United States National Guard.

12-13.title: Abel Tasman Sights New Zealand
