12-13.description: On December 13, 1642, Dutch explorer Abel Tasman became the first European to sight the South Island of present-day New Zealand.

12-13.title: International Court of Justice Established
12-13.description: On December 13, 1920, the League of Nations established the International Court of Justice in The Hague.

12-13.title: EU Announces Expansion
12-13.description: On December 13, 2002, the European Union announced that 10 new countries would become members from May 1, 2004.

12-13.title: Saddam Hussein Captured
12-13.description: On December 13, 2003, former Iraqi President Saddam Hussein was captured by U.S. forces near his hometown of Tikrit.

12-14.title: Uthman ibn Affan Appointed Third Caliph
12-14.description: On December 14, 644, Uthman ibn Affan, a companion of Muhammad, was appointed the third caliph of Islam.

12-14.title: St. Lucia's Flood
12-14.description: On December 14, 1287, during St. Lucia's Flood in the Netherlands, a seawall collapsed with the loss of over 50,000 lives.

12-14.title: Mary, Queen of Scots, Crowned at 6 Days Old
12-14.description: On December 14, 1542, Princess Mary Stuart succeeded her father James V and became Queen Mary I of Scotland at 6 days old.

12-14.title: First Military Action of the American Revolution
12-14.description: On December 14, 1774, New Hampshire militiamen attacked Fort William and Mary, seizing gunpowder and weapons in one of the first overt acts of the American Revolution.

12-14.title: Roald Amundsen Reaches the South Pole
12-14.description: On December 14, 1911, Norwegian explorer Roald Amundsen's Antarctic expedition became the first to reach the South Pole.

12-14.title: Dayton Agreement Signed
12-14.description: On December 14, 1995, the Dayton Agreement was signed in Paris, formally ending the Bosnian War.

12-15.title: Battle of Tricamarum
12-15.description: On December 15, 533, Byzantine general Belisarius defeated the Vandals led by King Gelimer at the Battle of Tricamarum.

12-15.title: Mongols Destroy Hashshashin Stronghold
12-15.description: On December 15, 1256, Hulagu Khan captured and destroyed the Hashshashin stronghold at Alamut in present-day Iran.

12-15.title: Bartolomeu Dias Rounds Cape of Good Hope
12-15.description: On December 15, 1488, Bartolomeu Dias returned to Portugal after becoming the first known European to sail around the Cape of Good Hope.

12-15.title: Andromeda Galaxy First Observed Through Telescope
12-15.description: On December 15, 1612, German astronomer Simon Marius became the first to observe the Andromeda Galaxy through a telescope.

12-15.title: U.S. Bill of Rights Ratified
12-15.description: On December 15, 1791, the U.S. Bill of Rights was ratified, becoming the first 10 amendments to the Constitution.

12-15.title: Napoleon Bonaparte's State Funeral
12-15.description: On December 15, 1840, Napoleon Bonaparte received a French state funeral in Paris, 19 years after his death.

12-15.title: ANZAC Forces Withdraw from Gallipoli
12-15.description: On December 15, 1915, ANZAC forces began their withdrawal from the Gallipoli Peninsula after failing to defeat Ottoman forces.

12-15.title: Homosexuality Removed from APA List of Mental Disorders
12-15.description: On December 15, 1973, the American Psychiatric Association removed homosexuality from its list of mental disorders.

12-16.title: An Lushan Rebellion Begins
12-16.description: On December 16, 755, An Lushan revolted against the Chinese Tang dynasty, initiating the An Lushan Rebellion.

12-16.title: Battle of Noryang Point
12-16.description: On December 16, 1598, in the final naval battle of the Imjin War, allied Korean and Chinese fleets decisively defeated the Japanese.

12-16.title: Oliver Cromwell Becomes Lord Protector
12-16.description: On December 16, 1653, Parliamentarian General Oliver Cromwell was appointed Lord Protector of England, Scotland, and Ireland.

12-16.title: Boston Tea Party
12-16.description: On December 16, 1773, the Boston Tea Party took place as Sons of Liberty protesters threw tea shipments into Boston Harbor to protest the Tea Act.

12-16.title: Gansu Earthquake in China
12-16.description: On December 16, 1920, an 8.5 magnitude earthquake rocked Gansu Province in China, killing an estimated 200,000 people.

12-16.title: Battle of the Bulge Begins
12-16.description: On December 16, 1944, Nazi Germany launched a counteroffensive against the Allies in the Ardennes region of Belgium, beginning the Battle of the Bulge.

12-16.title: Operation Desert Fox
12-16.description: On December 16, 1998, the United States and United Kingdom began Operation Desert Fox, bombing targets in Iraq to degrade its weapons capabilities.

12-17.title: Tamerlane Sacks Delhi
12-17.description: On December 17, 1398, Tamerlane captured and sacked Delhi after defeating the Sultan's army by using flaming camels to scare war elephants.

12-17.title: Inquisition Authorized in Portugal
12-17.description: On December 17, 1531, Pope Clement VII published a papal bull authorizing the Inquisition in Portugal.

12-17.title: Russian Army Captures Ochakov Fortress
12-17.description: On December 17, 1788, the Russian army led by Grigory Potemkin captured the fortress of Ochakov during the Russo-Turkish War.

12-17.title: First Airplane Flight
12-17.description: On December 17, 1903, Orville Wright piloted the first sustained, powered, and controlled flight of a heavier-than-air aircraft at Kitty Hawk, North Carolina.

12-17.title: First Combined Heart, Lung, and Liver Transplant
12-17.description: On December 17, 1986, Davina Thompson made medical history by undergoing the first combined heart, lung, and liver transplant.

12-18.title: Battle of the Trebia
12-18.description: On December 18, 218 BC, Hannibal's Carthaginian army heavily defeated Roman forces at the Battle of the Trebia during the Second Punic War.

12-18.title: Kublai Khan Establishes Yuan Dynasty
12-18.description: On December 18, 1271, Mongol Emperor Kublai Khan renamed his empire 'Yuan,' marking the start of the Yuan Dynasty of China.

12-18.title: First Dutch East India Company Fleet Departs
12-18.description: On December 18, 1603, the first fleet of the Dutch East India Company departed for the East Indies.

12-18.title: Abel Tasman Makes First European Contact with Māori
12-18.description: On December 18, 1642, Abel Tasman's expedition made the first confirmed European contact with the Māori people of New Zealand.

12-18.title: 18th Amendment (Prohibition) Approved by Congress
12-18.description: On December 18, 1917, the 18th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution, authorizing the prohibition of alcohol, was approved by Congress and sent to the states.

12-18.title: World's First Full-Scale Nuclear Power Plant for Peacetime
12-18.description: On December 18, 1957, the world's first full-scale nuclear power plant for peacetime use began generating electricity at the Shippingport Atomic Power Station.

12-18.title: Budweiser Rocket Unofficially Breaks Sound Barrier
12-18.description: On December 18, 1979, stuntman Stanley Barrett unofficially broke the land speed record and the sound barrier in his three-wheeled Budweiser Rocket.

12-18.title: U.S. House Impeaches President Donald Trump
12-18.description: On December 18, 2019, the U.S. House of Representatives voted to impeach President Donald Trump for abuse of power and obstruction of Congress.

12-19.title: Thomas Paine Publishes 'The American Crisis'
12-19.description: On December 19, 1776, Thomas Paine published his first 'The American Crisis' essay, beginning 'These are the times that try men's souls'.

12-19.title: William Pitt the Younger Becomes Youngest British PM
12-19.description: On December 19, 1783, William Pitt the Younger became the youngest-ever British Prime Minister at age 24.

12-19.title: BBC Begins Overseas Transmissions
12-19.description: On December 19, 1932, the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) began overseas transmissions, which would become the BBC World Service.

12-19.title: First Radio Broadcast from Space
12-19.description: On December 19, 1958, the first radio broadcast from space was transmitted, a Christmas message from U.S. President Dwight D. Eisenhower.

12-19.title: Sino-British Joint Declaration Signed
12-19.description: On December 19, 1984, Chinese Premier Zhao Ziyang and British Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher signed the Sino-British Joint Declaration, agreeing to transfer sovereignty over Hong Kong to China in 1997.

12-20.title: Siege of Rhodes Ends
12-20.description: On December 20, 1522, Suleiman the Magnificent accepted the surrender of the surviving Knights of Rhodes, who were allowed to evacuate.

12-20.title: Louisiana Purchase Formally Transferred to U.S.
12-20.description: On December 20, 1803, the French flag was lowered in New Orleans to signify the formal transfer of the Louisiana Purchase from France to the United States.

12-20.title: 'Grimm's Fairy Tales' First Published
12-20.description: On December 20, 1812, 'Grimm's Fairy Tales' by Jacob and Wilhelm Grimm was first published.

12-20.title: South Carolina Secedes from the Union
12-20.description: On December 20, 1860, the South Carolina General Assembly voted to secede from the United States, a key event leading to the American Civil War.

12-20.title: Soviet Security Force Cheka Forms
12-20.description: On December 20, 1917, the Soviet state security force and forerunner to the KGB, the Cheka, was formed under Felix Dzerzhinsky.

12-20.title: Viet Cong Formally Formed
12-20.description: On December 20, 1960, the National Liberation Front, better known as the Viet Cong, was officially formed in South Vietnam.

12-21.title: Mayflower Pilgrims Land at Plymouth
12-21.description: On December 21, 1620 (New Style), the Mayflower Pilgrims came ashore in Plymouth Bay, traditionally believed to be at Plymouth Rock, Massachusetts.

12-21.title: Pierre and Marie Curie Discover Radium
12-21.description: On December 21, 1898, scientists Pierre and Marie Curie discovered the radioactive element radium.

12-21.title: Apollo 8 Launched for First Manned Moon Voyage
12-21.description: On December 21, 1968, the first manned voyage to the Moon was launched with Frank Borman, Jim Lovell, and William Anders aboard Apollo 8.

12-21.title: Lockerbie Bombing of Pan Am Flight 103
12-21.description: On December 21, 1988, a terrorist bomb destroyed Pan Am Flight 103 over Lockerbie, Scotland, killing all 259 on board and 11 people on the ground.

12-21.title: Soviet Union Formally Dissolves
12-21.description: On December 21, 1991, the Soviet Union was formally dissolved as 11 of its 12 remaining republics signed a treaty forming the Commonwealth of Independent States.

12-22.title: Russian Army Storms Izmail Fortress
12-22.description: On December 22, 1790, the supposedly impenetrable Turkish fortress of Izmail was stormed and captured by Russian armies during the Russo-Turkish War.

12-22.title: First Prime Minister of Japan Appointed
12-22.description: On December 22, 1885, Itō Hirobumi became the first Prime Minister of Japan.

12-22.title: Romanian Revolution Ousts Ceaușescu
12-22.description: On December 22, 1989, after 23 years of dictatorial rule, Romania ousted communist dictator Nicolae Ceaușescu from power.

12-22.title: Lech Wałęsa Sworn in as Poland's President
12-22.description: On December 22, 1990, labor activist Lech Wałęsa was sworn in as Poland's first popularly elected president.

12-22.title: HistoryOrb.com Launched
12-22.description: On December 22, 2000, the history website later known as OnThisDay.com was launched as HistoryOrb.com.

12-22.title: Repeal of 'Don't Ask, Don't Tell'
12-22.description: On December 22, 2010, the repeal of the 'Don't Ask, Don't Tell' policy, which had banned openly gay, lesbian, and bisexual people from serving in the U.S. military, was signed into law.

12-23.title: Sack of Aleppo by Byzantine Troops
12-23.description: On December 23, 962, Byzantine troops stormed the city of Aleppo and recovered the tunic of John the Baptist.

12-23.title: King James II Flees to France
12-23.description: On December 23, 1688, King James II, the last Roman Catholic British monarch, fled to France from William of Orange.

12-23.title: George Washington Resigns Military Commission
12-23.description: On December 23, 1783, General George Washington resigned his military commission as Commander-in-Chief of the Army to Congress.

12-23.title: Vincent van Gogh Cuts Off His Ear
12-23.description: On December 23, 1888, Vincent van Gogh cut off part of his left ear with a razor after an argument with fellow painter Paul Gauguin.

12-23.title: Federal Reserve Act Signed
12-23.description: On December 23, 1913, President Woodrow Wilson signed the Federal Reserve Act, establishing the modern central banking system of the United States.

12-23.title: Government of Ireland Act Partitions Ireland
12-23.description: On December 23, 1920, the Government of Ireland Act (Home Rule Act) was passed, partitioning Ireland into Northern and Southern Ireland.

12-23.title: First Successful Human Kidney Transplant
12-23.description: On December 23, 1954, the first successful human kidney transplant was performed by Dr. Joseph E. Murray in Boston, Massachusetts.

12-23.title: Apollo 8 Orbits the Moon
12-23.description: On December 23, 1968, Frank Borman, Jim Lovell, and William Anders became the first people to orbit the Moon aboard Apollo 8.

12-24.title: Compromise of the Nobles
12-24.description: On December 24, 1565, the Compromise of the Nobles was formed in the Habsburg Netherlands to protest the Inquisition.

12-24.title: Treaty of Ghent Signed
12-24.description: On December 24, 1814, the Treaty of Ghent was signed, ending the War of 1812 between the United States and the United Kingdom.

12-24.title: Fire at U.S. Library of Congress
12-24.description: On December 24, 1851, a fire devastated the U.S. Library of Congress and destroyed 35,000 volumes.

12-24.title: First Radioactive Isotope Medicine Administered
12-24.description: On December 24, 1936, the first radioactive isotope medicine was administered in Berkeley, California.

12-24.title: Eisenhower Appointed Supreme Commander of Allied Forces
12-24.description: On December 24, 1943, US President Franklin D. Roosevelt appointed General Dwight D. Eisenhower as Supreme Commander of the Allied Expeditionary Force.

12-25.title: Traditional Date of Jesus's Birth
12-25.description: December 25, 1 AD, is the traditional date for the first Christmas, according to the calendar-maker Dionysius Exiguus.

12-25.title: Charlemagne Crowned Holy Roman Emperor
12-25.description: On December 25, 800, Pope Leo III crowned Charles the Great (Charlemagne) as Holy Roman Emperor.

12-25.title: William the Conqueror Crowned King of England
12-25.description: On December 25, 1066, William the Conqueror was crowned King of England at Westminster Abbey, completing the Norman Conquest.

12-25.title: Celsius Temperature Scale Introduced
12-25.description: On December 25, 1741, astronomer Anders Celsius introduced the Centigrade temperature scale, which was later renamed Celsius.

12-25.title: President Johnson Pardons Confederate Soldiers
12-25.description: On December 25, 1868, U.S. President Andrew Johnson granted an unconditional pardon to all persons involved in the Southern rebellion (Civil War).

12-25.title: Mikhail Gorbachev Resigns as President of USSR
12-25.description: On December 25, 1991, Mikhail Gorbachev formally resigned as President of the USSR in a televised speech.

12-26.title: First Spanish Settlement in the New World Founded
12-26.description: On December 26, 1492, the first Spanish settlement in the New World, La Navidad, was founded in Haiti from the wreckage of the Santa María.

12-26.title: King Louis XVI's Defense Presented at Trial
12-26.description: On December 26, 1792, during the trial of French King Louis XVI, the court heard the king's defense.

12-26.title: Decembrist Uprising in Russia
12-26.description: On December 26, 1825, the Decembrist uprising in Russia against Tsar Nicholas I began.

12-26.title: Battle of Bastogne: Patton's Third Army Repulses Germans
12-26.description: On December 26, 1944, during the Battle of the Bulge, U.S. General George S. Patton's Third Army broke through to relieve the besieged town of Bastogne.

12-26.title: Boxing Day Tsunami
12-26.description: On December 26, 2004, a 9.3 magnitude earthquake created a tsunami that devastated coastal regions of the Indian Ocean, killing about 230,000 people.

12-27.title: Laws of Burgos Issued
12-27.description: On December 27, 1512, the Spanish Crown issued the Laws of Burgos, governing the conduct of settlers with regard to native peoples in the New World.

12-27.title: Flushing Remonstrance Signed
12-27.description: On December 27, 1657, the Flushing Remonstrance petition was signed in the Dutch colony of New Netherland, protesting the ban on Quaker worship.

12-27.title: Erzincan Earthquake in Turkey
12-27.description: On December 27, 1939, a magnitude 8.0 earthquake in Erzincan, Turkey, killed between 30,000 and 40,000 people.

12-27.title: IMF and World Bank Formally Established
12-27.description: On December 27, 1945, the International Monetary Fund and the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (part of the World Bank) were formally established.

12-27.title: Netherlands Recognizes Indonesian Independence
12-27.description: On December 27, 1949, Queen Juliana of the Netherlands formally recognized the independence of Indonesia.

12-27.title: Soviet Forces Carry Out Coup in Afghanistan
12-27.description: On December 27, 1979, Soviet forces carried out a coup in Kabul, killing President Hafizullah Amin and replacing him with Babrak Karmal.

12-28.title: Westminster Abbey Consecrated
12-28.description: On December 28, 1065, a new church devoted to St Peter the Apostle was consecrated by Edward the Confessor in London, later known as Westminster Abbey.

12-28.title: First Observation of Neptune
12-28.description: On December 28, 1612, Galileo observed and recorded a 'fixed star' without realizing it was the planet Neptune.

12-28.title: King Taksin Crowned King of Siam
12-28.description: On December 28, 1767, King Taksin was crowned King of Siam and established Thonburi as his capital.

12-28.title: Spain Recognizes Mexico's Independence
12-28.description: On December 28, 1836, Spain formally recognized the independence of Mexico.

12-28.title: Harriet Tubman's Last Underground Railroad Mission
12-28.description: On December 28, 1860, Harriet Tubman arrived in Auburn, New York, on her last mission to free slaves via the Underground Railroad.

12-28.title: Messina Earthquake
12-28.description: On December 28, 1908, an earthquake struck Messina, Italy, killing nearly 80,000 people and causing a devastating tsunami.

12-28.title: Soviet Deportation of the Kalmyks
12-28.description: On December 28, 1943, the Kalmyk inhabitants of the Republic of Kalmykia were forcibly deported by the Soviet Union to Central Asia and Siberia.

12-29.title: Treaty of New Echota Signed
12-29.description: On December 29, 1835, the Treaty of New Echota was signed, ceding all Cherokee lands east of the Mississippi River to the United States and leading to the Trail of Tears.

12-29.title: Texas Admitted as 28th U.S. State
12-29.description: On December 29, 1845, Texas was admitted as the 28th state of the United States.

12-29.title: French Equatorial Africa Separates into Colonies
12-29.description: On December 29, 1903, French Equatorial Africa was separated into Gabon, Chad, and Ubangi-Shari (Central African Republic).

12-29.title: Sun Yat-sen Elected First President of Republic of China
12-29.description: On December 29, 1911, Chinese revolutionary Sun Yat-sen was elected the first President of the Republic of China.

12-29.title: Hong Kong Slaughters Chickens to Prevent Bird Flu
12-29.description: On December 29, 1997, Hong Kong began slaughtering all of its chickens to prevent the spread of avian influenza (bird flu).

12-30.title: Battle of Wakefield
12-30.description: On December 30, 1460, at the Battle of Wakefield, the Duke of York was killed and his forces were defeated during the Wars of the Roses.

12-30.title: All-India Muslim League Founded
12-30.description: On December 30, 1906, the All-India Muslim League was founded in Dacca, British India, which later laid the foundations for the state of Pakistan.

12-30.title: USSR Formally Proclaimed
12-30.description: On December 30, 1922, the creation of the USSR was formally proclaimed in Moscow.

12-30.title: Edwin Hubble Announces Existence of Other Galaxies
12-30.description: On December 30, 1924, astronomer Edwin Hubble formally announced the existence of other galaxies.

12-30.title: Vietnam, Laos, and Cambodia Become Independent States
12-30.description: On December 30, 1949, Vietnam, Laos, and Cambodia became independent states within the French Union.

12-31.title: 'Great Invasion' of Gaul
12-31.description: On December 31, 406, a vast horde of Vandals, Alans, and Suebi crossed the Rhine, beginning the invasion of Gaul.

12-31.title: Genroku Earthquake in Japan
12-31.description: On December 31, 1703, the Genroku earthquake off the coast of Japan near Edo (modern-day Tokyo) killed thousands and triggered a large tsunami.

12-31.title: Discovery of Earth's Nutation (Wobble)
12-31.description: On December 31, 1728, English astronomer James Bradley announced the discovery of Earth's nutation, or wobble.

12-31.title: Battle of Quebec
12-31.description: On December 31, 1775, at the Battle of Quebec, the American Continental Army was defeated while trying to take the British stronghold.

12-31.title: Record Rainfall in Cherrapunji, India
12-31.description: On December 31, 1861, a world record 22,990 mm (about 905 inches) of rain was recorded for the year in Cherrapunji, India.

12-31.title: Cuban Dictator Fulgencio Batista Flees
12-31.description: On December 31, 1958, Cuban dictator Fulgencio Batista informed his cabinet that he was fleeing the country as revolutionary forces advanced.
